so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:85" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberales disciplinas omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut primum forum attigi, i. e. accessi, adii,</quote> <trans><tr>applied myself to public affairs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militiam resque bellicas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curam rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Venerem seram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:701" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 701</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4365.14" n="3" level="3"> (Acc. to I. B. 4.) <hi rend="ital">To arrive somewhere</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ab illo attigisset nuntius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 19</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 3</bibl>: si a me tetigit nuntius).—</sense><sense id="n4365.15" n="4" level="3"> (Acc. to I. B. 5.) <hi rend="ital">To come near to in quality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be similar;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to belong to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appertain to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to concern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relate to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae nihil attingunt ad rem nec sunt usui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec quemque attigit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">attingit animi naturam corporis similitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:13:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 13, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Q. Fr. 1, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae non magis legis nomen attingunt, quam si latrones aliqua sanxerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Segestana, Centuripina civitas, quae cum officiis, fide, vetustate, tum etiam cognatione populi Romani nomen attingunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(labor) non attingit deum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:9:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primus ille (locus), qui in veri cognitione consistit, maxime naturam attingit humanam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:6:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 6, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:33:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 33, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 9</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n4365.16" n="5" level="3"> Si quid eam humanitus attigisset (for the usu. euphemism, accidisset), <hi rend="ital">if any misfortune had happened to her</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 337</bibl>.!*? Ne me attiga atque aufer manum, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 75, 30</bibl> dub. (Rib. here reads <hi rend="ital">attigas</hi>, Com. Rel. p. 98): custodite istunc, ne attigat, Pac., Trag. Rel. p. 105 Rib.</sense></entryFree>
attinguo: <entryFree id="n4366" type="hapax" key="attinguo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">at-tinguo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adt-</orth>), no <sense id="n4366.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>tinctum, ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to moisten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sprinkle with a liquid</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Art. Vet. 1, 11, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
attis: <entryFree id="n4367" type="main" key="Attis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Attis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Atthis</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Atys</orth>, <itype>yos</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Attīn</orth>, <itype>īnis</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 21, p. 313</bibl> Bip.), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/attis</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">*)/attus, *)/atus, *)/attin</foreign>), <sense id="n4367.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a young Phrygian shepherd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whom Cybele loved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and made her priest on condition of perpetual chastity; but he broke his vow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">became insane</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and emasculated himself</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:223" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 223</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 9, 116</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
attitulo: <entryFree id="n4368" type="hapax" key="atti^tu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">at-tĭtŭlo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adt-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n4368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entitle</hi>, Rufin. Orig.</sense></entryFree>
attius: <entryFree id="n4369" type="main" key="Atti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Attĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Accĭus</orth> (both forms are equally attested; Attius predominated under the empire, and the Greeks always wrote <foreign lang="greek">*)/attios</foreign>. Teuffel), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/attios</foreign>, <sense id="n4369.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4369.1" n="I" level="1"> L. Attius, <hi rend="ital">a distinguished Roman poet of the ante-class. per.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">younger than Pacuvius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and his rival in tragedy and comedy.</hi> Of his poems a considerable number of fragments yet remain; cf. Bähr, <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> Gesch. pp. 44 and 45; Teuffel, Rom. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> § 49, and Schmid ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 56</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n4369.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Attĭānus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Acc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Attius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Attianum illud: nihil credo auguribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:34" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4369.3" n="II" level="1"> Attius Navius, <hi rend="ital">a soothsayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the presence and at the bidding of Tarquinius Priscus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut in pieces a stone with a razor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 36</bibl>; <cb n="ATTO" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 4</bibl>, n. 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:17:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 17, 31</bibl> sqq.; 2, 38, 80.—</sense><sense id="n4369.4" n="III" level="1"> P. Attius Varus, <hi rend="ital">a prœtor in Africa at the time of the civil war between Cœsar and Pompey</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 13</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n4369.5" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Attĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Attius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 15</bibl></cit> and 20.—</sense><sense id="n4369.6" n="IV" level="1"> T. Attius, <hi rend="ital">an orator of Pisaurum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the time of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
attolero: <entryFree id="n4370" type="hapax" key="atto^le^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">at-tŏlĕro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adt-</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">attŏllĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n4370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 116</bibl> Elm.</sense></entryFree>
attollo: <entryFree id="n4371" type="main" key="attollo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">at-tollo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">attolo</orth>, arch.), no <sense id="n4371.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to lift</hi> or <hi rend="ital">raise up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lift on high</hi> (in the poets and postAug. prose writers very frequent, but not in Cic.; syn.: tollo, erigo). </sense><sense id="n4371.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">super limen pedes attollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: pallium attollere, i. e. accingere (v. accingo), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 6, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum (regem) omnes apes ... saepe attollunt umeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 217</bibl></cit>: Nec semel irrisus triviis attollere curat Fracto crure planum, <hi rend="ital">to raise up the juggler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to help him up</hi>, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 58</bibl> Schmid: <cit><quote lang="la">parvumque attollite natum,</quote> <trans><tr>lift up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:387" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 387</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:503" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 503</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos humo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:448" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 448</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Et contra magnum potes hos (oculos) attollere solem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:15:37" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 15, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sed non attollere contra Sustinet haec oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:605" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 605</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Attollens Joseph oculos vidit etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:43:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 43, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timidum lumen ad lumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 293</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus jacentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:144" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus ulnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:847" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 847</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus ad caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua e mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 27, 43, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">attollite portas, principes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:23:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 23, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">23, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare ventis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Euphratem attolli,</quote> <trans><tr>swollen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in femur,</quote> <trans><tr>raises himself on his thigh</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:856" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 856</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:722" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 722</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se recto trunco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:822" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 822</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">attollentem se ab gravi casu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a terrā se attollentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 11, 36, § 62</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">With middle signif.: e mediis hunc (sc. Atlantem) harenis in caelum attolli prodidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">attollitur monte Pione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 115</bibl></cit>.—Of buildings, <hi rend="ital">to raise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">build</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">immensam molem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">attollitur opus in altitudinem XXXX. cubitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turres in centenos vicenos[que] attollebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 11</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum die stativorum campum alacritate discursu pulvere attolleres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:14:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 14, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:714" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 714</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4371.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to raise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exalt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sustain;</hi> also, <hi rend="ital">to enlarge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aggrandize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to render prominent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conspicuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to extol</hi> (so esp. freq. in Tac.): <cit><quote lang="la">Punica se quantis attollet gloria rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultro implacabilis ardet Attollitque animos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad consulatūs spem attollere animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rectos ac vividos animos non ut alii contundis ac deprimis, sed foves et attollis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:44:6" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 44, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Frangit et attollit vires in milite causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:6:51" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 6, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">attollique suum laetis ad sidera nomen vocibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto Ciceronis studio Brutus Cassiusque attollerentur,</quote> <trans><tr>were distinguished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:65" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 65</bibl></cit> Ruhnk. (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 14</bibl>: animadverti dici jam a quibusdam exornari etiam nimium a me Brutum, nimium Cassium ornari); so, <cit><quote lang="la">insignibus triumphi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 90</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res per similitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:68" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 68</bibl></cit>: his (frons) contrahitur, attollitur (<hi rend="ital">is drawn up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">raised</hi>), demittitur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">belloque et armis rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta in majus attollens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 15, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sua facta, suos casus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 25</bibl></cit>.— Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">attolo</orth>, of doubtful meaning: <cit><quote lang="la">Quis vetat qui ne attolat? Pac., Trag. Rel. p. 82 Rib.: Custodite istunc vos, ne vim qui attolat neve attigat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 105 (= auferre or afferre, Non.).</sense></entryFree>
attondeo: <entryFree id="n4372" type="main" key="attonde^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">at-tondĕo</orth> (better than <orth extent="full" lang="la">adt-</orth>), <itype>tondi, tonsum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (<sense id="n4372.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. redupl.</hi> sync. attodisse = attotondisse or attondisse, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cat. 8, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">* attondi = attonderi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Art. Vet. 2, 28, 36</bibl></cit>), <hi rend="ital">to shave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crop</hi> (rare, and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: tondeo, carpo, puto): rusticus Saturni dente relictam Persequitur vitem attondens,</quote> <trans><tr>pruning</tr>, <tr>he cuts off the vine around</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 407</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput attonsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 3</bibl></cit>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:44:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 44, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">comam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:19:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Lev. 19, 27</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ad cutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 10" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 10</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to gnaw at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nibble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenera attondent virgulta capellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">attonsa arva,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>fed down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mos. 203</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: consiliis nostris laus est attonsa Laconum, <hi rend="ital">shorn</hi>, <pb n="197" /> <cb n="ATTR" /> i. e. <hi rend="ital">diminished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lessened</hi>, vet. poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:17:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 17, 49</bibl> (as transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*(hmete/rais boulai=s *spa/rth me\n e)kei/rato do/can</foreign>, Plut. 2, p. 1098): <cit><quote lang="la">sic quoque attondentur,</quote> <trans><tr>cut off</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Nahum, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: attondere aliquem, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to cheat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fleece</hi> (cf. admutilo), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 18</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in a pun: attonsae quidem ambae usque sunt (oves),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">metuo, si senex resciverit, Ne ulmos parasitos faciat, quae usque attondeant,</quote> <trans><tr>rough-hew me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit> (cf. Horace's fuste dolat, S. 1, 5, 23).</sense></entryFree>
attonite: <entryFree id="n4373" type="main" key="atto^ni^te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">attŏnĭtē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adt-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. attono, <sense id="n4373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
attonitus: <entryFree id="n4374" type="main" key="atto^ni^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">attŏnĭtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adt-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>attono</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
attono: <entryFree id="n4375" type="main" key="atto^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">at-tŏno</orth> (better than <orth extent="full" lang="la">adt-</orth>), <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n4375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to thunder at;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">to stun</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupefy</hi> (a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> word of the Aug. per.; most frequent as <hi rend="ital">P. a.;</hi> syn.: percello, perturbo, terreo): altitudo attonat, Maecen. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis furor vestras attonuit mentes!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:532" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 532</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 50</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">attŏnĭtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adt-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">thundered at;</hi> hence trop. as in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)mbronthqei/s, e)mbro/nthtos</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n4375.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Thunderstruck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stunned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrified</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupefied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">astonished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amazed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confounded</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">attonitus est stupefactus. Nam proprie attonitus dicitur, cui casus vicini fulminis et sonitus tonitruum dant stuporem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 3, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo fragore edito concidunt homines, exanimantur, quidam vero vivi stupent, et in totum sibi excidunt, quos vocamus attonitos, quorum mentes sonus ille caelestis loco pepulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:27" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:4:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">talibus attonitus visis ac voce deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">attonitus tanto miserarum turbine rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:614" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 614</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 802</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 777</bibl>; 9, 409 and 574; 11, 127; 8, 681 al.: alii novitate ac miraculo attoniti, Liv 1, 47; 2, 12; 5, 46; 3, 68 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 7, 36; 30, 30; 39, 15; <cit><quote lang="la">44, 10: subitae rei miraculo attoniti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 49</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 42</bibl>; 3, 13. —With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentis de lodice parandā Attonitae,</quote> <trans><tr>crazed</tr>, <tr>bewildered about getting a bed-blanket</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:67" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 67</bibl></cit>.—Also without an <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">Attonitae manibusque uterum celare volenti, Ov M. 2, 463: mater ... Attonitae diu similis fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:ib. 5:510" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 510</bibl></cit>; 6, 600; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 498: ut integris corporibus attoniti conciderent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">attoniti vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumspectare inter se attoniti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">attonitis etiam victoribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">attonitā magis quam quietā contione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">attonitis jam omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">attonitos habes oculos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 15, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Prov 16, 30</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">attonitus serpentis equus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:231" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 231</bibl></cit>.—Also <usg type="style">poet.</usg> transf. to inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim ante dehiscent Attonitae magna ora domūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 53</bibl></cit> (but acc. to Serv. in an <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> sense, syn. with attonitos facientes, stupendae, <hi rend="ital">stunning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrifying</hi>, as pallida senectus, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">mensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:45" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:7" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 7</bibl></cit> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">quorundam persuasiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 8, § 28</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n4375.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Seized with inspiration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smitten with prophetic fury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inspired</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frantic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">attonitae Baccho matres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:580" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 580</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bacchus attonitae tribuit vexilla catervae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:116" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 116</bibl></cit>: Vates, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:19:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 19, 14</bibl>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">attŏnĭtē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">frantically</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Britannia hodieque eum attonite celebrat etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 1, 4, § 13</bibl></cit> (Jan, <hi rend="ital">attonita</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
attonsus: <entryFree id="n4376" type="main" key="attonsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">attonsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of attondeo.</entryFree>
attorqueo: <entryFree id="n4377" type="hapax" key="attorqueo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">at-torqueo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n4377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hurl</hi> or <hi rend="ital">swing upward</hi> (<hi rend="ital">ad</hi> designating direction upward, as in assurgo, attollo; cf. ad <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">jaculum attorquens emittit in auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 52</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
attorreo: <entryFree id="n4378" type="main" key="attorre^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">at-torrĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n4378.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roast</hi> (cf. assicco; <cit><quote lang="la">only in Apic.): nuces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:7:5" default="NO">7, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
attractio: <entryFree id="n4379" type="main" key="attracti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">attractĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>attraho</etym>, <sense id="n4379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drawing together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contraction</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">litterarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 6</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">rugarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Apr. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
attractorius: <entryFree id="n4380" type="hapax" key="attracto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">attractōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n4380.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having the power of attraction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attractive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus (sulphuris) est attractoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0923,001:4:19" default="NO"><author>Aem. Mac.</author> 4, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
attractus: <entryFree id="n4381" type="main" key="attractus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">at-tractus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of attraho.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4382" type="hapax" key="attractus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">attractus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>attraho</etym>, <sense id="n4382.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drawing to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attraction</hi>, Dictys, 5, 11.</sense></entryFree>
attraho: <entryFree id="n4383" type="main" key="attra^ho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">at-trăho</orth>, <itype>traxi, tractum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n4383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to draw to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">toward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to attract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drag with force</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw</hi> (rare but class.; syn.: traho, duco, adduco). </sense><sense id="n4383.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: adducitur a Veneriis<cb n="ATTR" />  atque adeo attrahitur Lollius, <hi rend="ital">is dragged by force</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">te ipsum putare me attractum iri, si de pace agatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem Romam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunos attrahi ad se jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uncus alae iniciendus paulatimque attrahendus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnes attrahens ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 16, 25, § 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulmo attrahens ac reddens animam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 72, § 188</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">spiritum attrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:118:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 118, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus tuus colligit rugas et attrahit frontem,</quote> <trans><tr>contracts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:7 al" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 7 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae causa attraxerit Arpos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 250</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed quos fugit, attrahit unā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducem Attrahite huc vinctum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:563" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 563</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 435</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnes attrahere auxilio sitientibus hortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:24" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">attraxit eum in siccum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Tob. 6, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:32:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Ezech. 32, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugum attrahere,</quote> <trans><tr>to draw</tr>, <tr>bear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:28:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Eccli. 28, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4383.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to draw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">move</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attract</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil esse quod ad se rem ullam tam inliciat et tam attrahat quam ad amicitiam similitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:14:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 14, 50</bibl></cit>: recepi causam Siciliae; <cit><quote lang="la">ea me ad hoc negotium provincia attraxit,</quote> <trans><tr>prompted</tr>, <tr>moved</tr>, <tr>incited</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quandoquidem in partes, ait, attrahor,</quote> <trans><tr>I am drawn by force to take sides</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 93</bibl></cit> (Merk., <hi rend="ital">abstrahor</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">discipulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:830" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 830</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ideo attraxi te miserans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 31, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">attractus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">drawn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">attracted;</hi> of the brow, <hi rend="ital">contracted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">knit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons attractior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:31" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
attrectatio: <entryFree id="n4384" type="main" key="attrecta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">attrectātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adt-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>attrecto</etym>. <sense id="n4384.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A touching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">handling</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:18:23" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 18, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves frequenti manūs attrectatione mansuescere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 12, 1 al.</bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n4384.1" n="II" level="1"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">a term applied to words which denote a taking of many things together;</hi> as, fasceatim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
attrectatus: <entryFree id="n4385" type="hapax" key="attrecta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">attrectātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adt-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n4385.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a handling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">touching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feeling</hi>: nam attrectatu et quassu Saevum amplificatis dolorem, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:21:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 21, 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
attrecto: <entryFree id="n4386" type="main" key="attrecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">at-trecto</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">adt-</orth>, Weissenb., Halm; <orth extent="full" lang="la">att-</orth>, <itype>Ritschl</itype>, Rib., Kayser), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>tracto</etym>, <sense id="n4386.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to touch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">handle</hi>, freq. in an unlawful manner (syn.: contrecto, tracto, tango, palpo). </sense><sense id="n4386.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ne me attrecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem nimium familiariter attr ectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxorem alicujus attrectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 26</bibl> (cf. contrecto): <cit><quote lang="la">signum Junonis adtrecta re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrios penates attrectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:719" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 719</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feralia adtrectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 62 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libros contaminatis manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:chapter=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 13</bibl></cit>: alienam rem, Sabin. Jus Civ. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:16:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 16, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si attrectaverit me pater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:27:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 27, 12</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">To feel after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grope for</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">quasi absque oculis parietem attrectavimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:59:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 59, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4386.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: Facilis est illa occursatio et blanditia popularis; aspicitur, non attrectatur; <cit><quote lang="la">procul apparet, non excutitur (the figure is derived from paintings or other works of art),</quote> <trans><tr>it is looked at</tr>, <tr>not touched</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 12</bibl></cit> Wund.—Also, <hi rend="ital">to appropriate to one's self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regias etiam adtrectamus gazas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fasces securesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indecorum, adtrectare quod non obtineret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 52</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">To feel after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seek to find</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">quaerere Deum, si forte attrectent eum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:17:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 17, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
attremo: <entryFree id="n4387" type="main" key="attre^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">at-trĕmo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n4387.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tremble at a thing</hi> (post Aug., and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:81" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censurae alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 6, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
attrepido: <entryFree id="n4388" type="hapax" key="attre^pi^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">at-trĕpĭdo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n4388.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hobble along</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">attrepidate saltem: nam vos approperare haud postulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
attribulo: <entryFree id="n4389" type="hapax" key="attri^bu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">at-trĭbŭlo</orth>, no <sense id="n4389.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to press hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to thresh</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">folliculus attribulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0923,001:4:6" default="NO"><author>Aem. Mac.</author> 4, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
attribuo: <entryFree id="n4390" type="main" key="attri^bu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">at-trĭbŭo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">adt-</orth>, Weissenb., Jan; <orth extent="full" lang="la">att-</orth>, B. and K., L. Müller), <itype>ŭi, ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n4390.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to associate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">add</hi> or <hi rend="ital">join to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to annex</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bestow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give</hi> (class., but rare in the poets; syn.: tribuo, assigno, do, ascribo, addico). </sense><sense id="n4390.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n4390.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueros attribue ei, quot et quos videbitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">video, cui Apulia sit attributa,</quote> <trans><tr>assigned as a province</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insulae Rhodiis attributae,</quote> <trans><tr>annexed</tr>, <tr>subjected</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Q. Fr. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Camunni finitimis adtributi municipiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 20, 24, § 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos gladiatoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (juventus) praesidio ejus loci adtributa erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 21</bibl></cit>: pontifici sacra omnia. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 20</bibl>: possessionem,<cb n="ATYP" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:36:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 36, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:29:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Deut. 29, 26</bibl></cit>.—Of the assigning of state domains or other possessions belonging to the public treasures: <cit><quote lang="la">bona oppressorum in Vesvio restitutioni afflictarum civitatium attribuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:8 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 8 al.</bibl></cit>—Hence of appropriations from the exchequer: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:14:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 14, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aliquam rem pecuniam dare, attribuere, solvere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 14</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">so Liv 40, 51.—Also of private assignments: Faberius si venerit, videbis, ut tantum attribuatur, quantum debetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence also aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to assign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make over to any one</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">attributos quod appellas, valde probo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>my debtors</tr>, <tr>to whom I have referred you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4390.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">timor, quem mihi natura pudorque meus attribuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Suus cuique attributus est error,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:22:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 22, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si alicui rei hujus modi, legi, loco, urbi, monumento oratio attribuetur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>if these are represented as speaking</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv 1, 52, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curam alicujus rei adtribuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4390.4" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n4390.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To join in addition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to add</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non attribuere ad amissionem amicorum miseriam nostram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:30:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 30, 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4390.6" n="B" level="2"> Aliquid alicui, <hi rend="ital">to attribute</hi> or <hi rend="ital">impute to one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to charge with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ascribe to</hi> (cf. ascribo): <cit><quote lang="la">si eruditius videbitur disputare, attribuito Graecis litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hoc tu si cupidius factum existimas, Caesari attribues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonos exitus dis immortalibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:37:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 37, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliis causam calamitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4390.7" n="C" level="2"> T. t., <hi rend="ital">to lay as a tax</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tribute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">his rebus omnibus terni in milia aeris adtribuerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 44</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">attrĭbūtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adt-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, lit. <hi rend="ital">that is ascribed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">attributed to a thing;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">attrĭbūtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n4390.8" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to I.) <hi rend="ital">Money assigned from the public treasury</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=181" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 181</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n4390.9" n="B" level="2"> In gram. lang., <hi rend="ital">a predicate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attribute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Omnes res confirmantur aut ex eo, quod personis, aut ex eo, quod negotiis est attributum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:24:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 24, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 25, 36</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
attributio: <entryFree id="n4391" type="main" key="attri^bu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">attrĭbūtĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adt-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>attribuo</etym>. <sense id="n4391.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The assignment of a money-debt</hi> (cf. attribuo, I.). </sense><sense id="n4391.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">de attributione conficies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 13, 5</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 1</bibl> and 3.—</sense><sense id="n4391.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: Graeci Fatum ... <foreign lang="greek">*ne/mesin</foreign> vocant, quod unicuique attributio sua sit adscripta, i. e. <hi rend="ital">his fate is meted out</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Mund. p. 754</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4391.3" n="II" level="1"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">a predicate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attribute</hi>, = attributum ex his etiam attributionibus: <cit><quote lang="la">sacer an profanus, publicus an privatus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:26:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 26, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
attributus: <entryFree id="n4392" type="main" key="attri^bu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">attrĭbūtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adt-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of attribuo.</entryFree>
attritio: <entryFree id="n4393" type="main" key="attri_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">attrītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>attero</etym>, <sense id="n4393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rubbing upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">against</hi> something, <hi rend="ital">friction</hi> (perh. only in the foll. exs.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, p. 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
attritus: <entryFree id="n4394" type="main" key="attri_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">attrītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. attero.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4395" type="main" key="attri_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">attrītus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>attero</etym>, <sense id="n4395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rubbing on</hi> or <hi rend="ital">against</hi> something (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n4395.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">(sues) inter se dimicant indurantes attritu arborum costas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 52, 78, § 212</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:147" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 45, 68, § 147</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:208" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 40, 77, § 208</bibl>; 37, 3, 12, § 48; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4395.2" n="II" level="1"> Med. t., <hi rend="ital">an inflammation of the skin caused by rubbing</hi> (cf. attero, <hi rend="ital">P a.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">ulcera ex attritu facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 35, § 105</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:91" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 8, 58, § 91</bibl> (Jan, <hi rend="ital">trita</hi>); 28, 16, 62, § 222.</sense></entryFree>
attuarii: <entryFree id="n4396" type="main" key="Attu^a_rii"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Attŭārii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n4396.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a German tribe between the Rhine and the Elbe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:105" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 105</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 10</bibl> (perh. the Chasuarii of Tacitus, G. 34; cf. Mann. Germ. p. 179, and Rupert. ad Tac. l. c.).</sense></entryFree>
attubernalis: <entryFree id="n4397" type="gloss" key="attu^berna_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">attŭbernālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>qs. from attaberna, as contubernium from contaberna</etym>, <sense id="n4397.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that inhabits an adjoining hut</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=12" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 12</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
attulo: <entryFree id="n4398" type="main" key="attu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">at-tŭlo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adt-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, a very ancient form for affero, <sense id="n4398.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring to</hi>: dotem ad nos nullam attulas, Nov. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 376</bibl> P. (Com. Rel. p. 268 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
attys: <entryFree id="n4399" type="main" key="Attys"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Attys</orth>, v. Attis and Atys.</entryFree>
aturus: <entryFree id="n4400" type="main" key="A^tu_^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ătū^rus</orth> (on account of the length of the <sense id="n4400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">u</hi>, sometimes written Aturrus; cf. Arabia; once <hi rend="ital">ŭ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:420" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 420</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)atou/rios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a river in Aquitania</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Adour</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Parent. 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mos. 468</bibl>; cf. Mann. Gall. p. 116.</sense></entryFree>
atypus: <entryFree id="n4401" type="greek" key="a^ty^pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ătypus</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/tupos, on</foreign>, <sense id="n4401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that stammers in speaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stammering</hi>: balbus autem et atypus vitiosi magis quam morbosi sunt, Cael. Sabin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:2:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 2, 5</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 10</bibl>. <pb n="198" /> <cb n="AUCT" /></sense></entryFree>
atys: <entryFree id="n4402" type="main" key="A^tys"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ătys</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Attys</orth>, <itype>yos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/atus, *)/ttus</foreign> (diff. from Attis, q. v.). <sense id="n4402.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Hercules and Omphale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of Tyrrhenus and Lydus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and ancestor of the Lydian kings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who are therefore called</hi> Atyadae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 55</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4402.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The ancestor of the</hi> gens Atia (cf. Atius), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:568" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 568</bibl> Wagner.—</sense><sense id="n4402.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Alba</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of the Albani</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
au: <entryFree id="n4403" type="main" key="au"><orth extent="full" lang="la">au</orth>, <pos>interj.</pos>, v. 2. hau.</entryFree>
aucella: <entryFree id="n4404" type="main" key="aucella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aucella</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">aucilla</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>as if for avicella, from avis</etym>, <sense id="n4404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little bird</hi> (only postclass.; <cit><quote lang="la">Varro, L. L. 8, § 79 Müll., said expressly that this form was not in use, but avicella),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. p. 656</bibl></cit> Oud., and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:5" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:5:3" default="NO">5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:7" default="NO">8, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
auceo: <entryFree id="n4405" type="hapax" key="auce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aucĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>avis, analog. to aucupo</etym>, <sense id="n4405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to observe attentively</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, p. 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
auceps: <entryFree id="n4406" type="main" key="auceps"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auceps</orth>, <itype>cŭpis</itype> (cipis, acc. to Vel. Long. Orthogr. p. 2235), <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>contr. for aviceps, from avis-capio</etym>, <sense id="n4406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bird-catcher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fowler.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4406.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Piscator, pistor apstulit, lanii, coqui, Holitores, myropolae, aucupes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veluti merulis intentus decidit auceps In puteum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 458</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi avis de manu aucupis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 6, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Jer. 5, 26</bibl>; ib. Amos, 3, 5: as <hi rend="ital">a bird-seller</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Edicit piscator uti, pomarius, auceps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Non avis aucupibus monstrat, quā parte petatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:669 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 669 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n4406.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a spy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eavesdropper</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumspice dum, ne quis nostro hic auceps sermoni siet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 9</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quis... nostro consilio venator adsit cum auritis plagis): Numquis hic est alienus nostris dictis auceps auribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatum auceps, Cic. Ac. Fragm. ap. Aug. contra Ac. 3, 7 (Orell. IV. 2, p. 470): praeco actionum, cantor formularum, auceps syllabarum,</quote> <trans><tr>a minute and trifling critic</tr>, <tr>a caviller</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 55, 236</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
auceta: <entryFree id="n4407" type="gloss" key="auceta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auceta</orth>, v. augeo <sense id="n4407.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
auchetae: <entryFree id="n4408" type="main" key="Auche_tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Auchētae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">Au)xa/tai</foreign>, <sense id="n4408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Scythian people in the present Ukraine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 88</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>, acc. to the Gr., <orth extent="full" lang="la">Auchātes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">an Auchatian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:132" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 132</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aucilla: <entryFree id="n4409" type="main" key="aucilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aucilla</orth>, v. aucella.</entryFree>
auctarium: <entryFree id="n4410" type="main" key="aucta_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auctārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>augeo</etym>, <sense id="n4410.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an addition</hi> or <hi rend="ital">augmentation</hi> of a definite measure: auctarium dicebant antiqui, quod super mensuram vel pondus justum adiciebatur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=14" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 14</bibl> Müll.: <hi rend="ital">Eu.</hi> Tanti quanti poscit, vin tanti illum emi? <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Immo auctarium Adicito, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 4, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
auctifer: <entryFree id="n4411" type="hapax" key="aucti^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auctĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>auctusfero</etym>, <sense id="n4411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fruit-bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruitful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fertile</hi>: terrae, Cic. ap. Aug. Civ. Dei, 5, 8 (Orell. IV. 2, p. 515), as a free transl. of Hom. Od. 18, 135 and 136.</sense></entryFree>
auctifico: <entryFree id="n4412" type="main" key="aucti^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auctĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>auctus-facio</etym>, <sense id="n4412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to increase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enlarge;</hi> in the lang. of sacrifice (like mactare and adolere), <hi rend="ital">to honor by offerings</hi> (only in Arn.): <cit><quote lang="la">cibis novis deos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honorem deorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> p. 223.</sense></entryFree>
auctificus: <entryFree id="n4413" type="hapax" key="aucti^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auctĭfĭcus, a</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">um</orth>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n4413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">increasing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enlarging</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nec porro rerum genitales auctificique Motus perpetuo possunt servare creata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:571" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 571</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
auctio: <entryFree id="n4414" type="main" key="aucti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>augeo</etym>. <sense id="n4414.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An increasing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increase</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">au)chsis</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctio frumenti et tributorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dierum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: rerum crescentium, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=17" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 17</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n4414.1" n="II" level="1"> A sale by <hi rend="ital">increase</hi> of bids, <hi rend="ital">a public sale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">auction.</hi> Auctions were held either in an open place, or in particular rooms or halls, called atria auctionaria (v. auctionarius), or simply atria (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:7" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 7</bibl>). There was a spear (hasta) set up therein, as the legal sign of the sale, like our red flag; the price was called out by a crier (praeco), and the article sold was adjudged to the highest bidder by the magistrate who was present. A money-broker (argentarius) was also present to note down the price and receive the money or security for it; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Smith, Dict. Antiq. (this is the class. signif. of the word): auctionem facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 91</bibl></cit>-94; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 6, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,001:chapter=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Quinct. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 3 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dicam auctionis causam, ut animo gaudeant, Ipse egomet quam ob rem auctionem praedicem,</quote> <trans><tr>announce</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 55</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">auctionis diem obire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proscribere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 37</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and proponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:99" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proferre,</quote> <trans><tr>to defer</tr>, <tr>adjourn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 13</bibl></cit>: amplissima praedia<cb n="AUCT" />  ex auctionibus hastae minimo addixit, <hi rend="ital">by the sales of the spear</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">by auctions</hi> (v. supra), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 50</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praebere caput dominā venale sub hastā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:33" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 33</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">auctio hereditaria constituta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctionis tabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 25</bibl></cit> (v. auctionalis): <cit><quote lang="la">auctio fortunae regiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vendere aliquid in auctione,</quote> <trans><tr>by auction</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 30, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res in auctione venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:4:126" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> 4, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex auctione rem emere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:4:2:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 31, 4, 2, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctionem dimittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 24</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n4414.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (abstr. pro concr.), <hi rend="ital">goods to be sold by auction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum auctionem venderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,001:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Quinct. 5, 19</bibl></cit> (B. and K.; others, <hi rend="ital">auctione</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
auctionalis: <entryFree id="n4415" type="hapax" key="aucti^o_na^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auctĭōnălis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>auctio</etym>, <sense id="n4415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to an auction;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">auctĭōnālĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">catalogues of auction sales</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:3:1:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 3, 1, § 3</bibl> (others, <hi rend="ital">actionalia</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
auctionarius: <entryFree id="n4416" type="main" key="aucti^o_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auctĭōnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n4416.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to an auction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">auction-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">atria,</quote> <trans><tr>wherein auctions were held</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3883</bibl> (v. atrium): <cit><quote lang="la">tabulae,</quote> <trans><tr>catalogues of goods to be sold by auction</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 8, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
auctionor: <entryFree id="n4417" type="main" key="aucti^o_nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auctĭōnor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n4417.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hold an auction</hi> or <hi rend="ital">public sale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make a sale by auction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in atriis auctionariis potius quam in triviis aut in compitis auctionentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ait se auctionatum esse in Galliā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,001:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Quinct. 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rullum hastā positā cum suis formosis finitoribus auctionantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficultates auctionandi proponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 20, 3</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n4417.1" n="II" level="1"> As <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to buy at auction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona condemnatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:ad Cic. Verr. 2:1:23" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> ad Cic. Verr. 2, 1, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
auctito: <entryFree id="n4418" type="main" key="aucti^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auctĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n4418.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. doub. freq.</hi> [augeo, aucto], <hi rend="ital">to increase</hi> or <hi rend="ital">augment much</hi> (only in the two foll. exs.). </sense><sense id="n4418.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunias faenore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4418.2" n="II" level="1"> In the lang. of sacrifices (cf.: augeo, auctifico, adoleo, macto, etc.), <hi rend="ital">to honor by offerings</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacris numinum potentiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 220</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aucto: <entryFree id="n4419" type="main" key="aucto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aucto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n4419.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq.</hi> [augeo], <hi rend="ital">to increase</hi> or <hi rend="ital">enlarge much</hi> (perh. only in the foll. exs.): <cit><quote lang="la">res rationesque vostrorum omnium Bono atque amplo auctare lucro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Unde omnis natura creet res auctet alatque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Salve, teque bonā Juppiter auctet ope,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:67:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 67, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
auctor: <entryFree id="n4420" type="main" key="auctor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auctor</orth> (incorrectly written <orth extent="full" lang="la">autor or author</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n4420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he that brings about the existence of any object</hi>, <hi rend="ital">or promotes the increase or prosperity of it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whether he first originates it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">or by his efforts gives greater permanence or continuance to it;</hi> to be differently translated according to the object, <hi rend="ital">creator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">author</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inventor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">producer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father</hi>, <hi rend="ital">founder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">teacher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">composer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">voucher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supporter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leader</hi>, <hi rend="ital">head</hi>, etc. (syn.: conditor, origo, consiliarius, lator, suasor, princeps, dux). </sense><sense id="n4420.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n4420.2" n="A" level="2"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">a progenitor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ancestor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Brutus, praeclarus auctor nobilitatis tuae,</quote> <trans><tr>the founder</tr>, <tr>progenitor of your nobility</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">generis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 365</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:640" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 640</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu sanguinis ultimus auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 49</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:558" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 558</bibl>, and 13, 142: <cit><quote lang="la">tantae propaginis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:157" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">originis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctores parentes animarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctore
