ab illo ducit originem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 17, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sive neglectum genus et nepotes Respicis auctor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi Tantalus auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctores saxa fretumque tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 10, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter e terrā genitam mentitur, ut auctor Desinat inquiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:615" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 615</bibl></cit>.—Of animals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:27:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 27, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4420.3" n="B" level="2"> Of buildings, etc., <hi rend="ital">founder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">builder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trojae Cynthius auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murorum Romulus auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:6:43" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 6, 43</bibl></cit> (<hi rend="ital">augur</hi>, Müll.): <cit><quote lang="la">auctor posuisset in oris Moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porticus auctoris Livia nomen habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amphitheatri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia sub titulo tantum suo ac sine ullā pristini auctoris memoriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4420.4" n="C" level="2"> Of works of art, <hi rend="ital">a maker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">artist</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">statua auctoris incerti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 93</bibl></cit>: apparuit summam artis securitatem auctori placaisse, id. praef. § 27.—</sense><sense id="n4420.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n4420.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">the originator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">executor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">performer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">doer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occasion</hi> of other things (freq. interchanged with actor): <cit><quote lang="la">tametsi haud quaquam par gloriá sequitur scriptorem et auctorem rerum, tamen etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 3, 2</bibl></cit> Kritz (cf. without rerum: Suam quisque culpam auctores ad negotia transferunt, id. <cb n="AUCT" /> J. 1, 4): <cit><quote lang="la">praeclari facinoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:120:6" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 120, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 206</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:8" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum perquirerent auctorem facti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jud. 6, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimi statūs auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Heb. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> ib. 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:449" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 449</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">9, 214: mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:493" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 493</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:133" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 133</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">8, 418: plagae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:329" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 329</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditionis sectae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 24, 5</bibl></cit>.—Also, in gen., <hi rend="ital">one from whom any thing proceeds</hi> or <hi rend="ital">comes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctor in incerto est: jaculum de parte sinistrā Venit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the sender</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:419" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 419</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">teli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:349" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 349</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muneris,</quote> <trans><tr>the giver</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 88</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 657, 7, 157 al.: meritorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:108" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 108</bibl></cit> al.—</sense><sense id="n4420.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An author of scientific or literary productions.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4420.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An investigator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sordidus auctor Naturae verique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 14</bibl></cit>.—And as imparting learning, <hi rend="ital">a teacher</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam in antiquissimā philosophiā Cratippo auctore versaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:2:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi gravissimus auctor et magister Plato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divini humanique juris auctor celeberrimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:26:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Servius Sulpicius, juris civilis auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:39" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 1, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:7:36" default="NO">40, 7, 36</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4420.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The author of a writing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a writer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ii quos nunc lectito auctores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingeniosus poëta et auctor valde bonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripta auctori perniciosa suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:1:68" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 1, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Belli Alexandrini Africique et Hispaniensis incertus auctor est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine auctore notissimi versus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>anonymous verses</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 70</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:8 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 8 al.</bibl>—<usg type="style">Meton.</usg> of cause for effect, for <hi rend="ital">a literary production</hi>, <hi rend="ital">writing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">work</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in evolvendis utriusque linguae auctoribus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:89" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 89</bibl></cit>. —In partic., <hi rend="ital">the author of historical works</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an historian</hi> (with and without <hi rend="ital">rerum</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">ego cautius posthac historiam attingam, te audiente, quem rerum Romanarum auctorem laudare possum religiosissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:11:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 11, 44</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Matrem Antoniam non apud auctores rerum, non diurnā actorum scripturā reperio ullo insigni officio functam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 30</bibl> (diff. from auctor rerum in II. A.): <cit><quote lang="la">Polybius bonus auctor in primis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:32:113" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 32, 113</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 64 al.</bibl>—With <hi rend="ital">historiae</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">historiae congruit auctori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 2, 31</bibl></cit>.—Hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">one that gives an account of something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a narrator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reporter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">informant</hi> (orally or in writing): <cit><quote lang="la">sibi insidias fieri: se id certis auctoribus comperisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeberrimos auctores habeo tantam victoribus irreverentiam fuisse, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">criminis ficti auctor, i. e. nuntius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:824" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 824</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Non haec tibi nuntiat auctor Ambiguus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:666" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 666</bibl></cit>; 12, 58; 12, 61; 12, 532.—Hence, auctorem esse, with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to relate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recount</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Auctores sunt ter novenis punctis interfici hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 21, 24, § 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fabius Rustiçus auctor est scriptos esse ad Caecinam Tuscum codicillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Auctor est Julius Marathus ante paucos quam nasceretur menses prodigium Romae factum (esse) publice, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n4420.10" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">One by whose influence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">command</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">any thing is done</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occasion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contriver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instigator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">counsellor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adviser</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promoter;</hi> constr. sometimes with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">gen. gerund.</hi>: quid mihi es auctor (<hi rend="ital">what do you counsel me?</hi>) huic ut mittam? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 7, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">idne estis auctores mihi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihique ut absim, vehementer auctor est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gellium ipsis (philosophis) magno opere auctorem fuisse, ut controversiarum facerent modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:20:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 20, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut propinqui de communi sententiā coërcerent, auctor fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a me consilium petis, qui sim tibi auctor in Siciliāne subsidas, an proficiscare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 8</bibl></cit>: ego quidem tibi non sim auctor, si Pompeius Italiam reliquit, te quoque profugere, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne auctor armorum duxque deesset, Auct. B. G. 8, 47: auctor facinori non deerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctores Bibulo fuere tantundem pollicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctores restituendae tribuniciae potestatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctor singulis universisque conspirandi simul et ut... communem causam juvarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:10 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 10 al.</bibl></cit>—So freq. in the <hi rend="ital">abl. absol.</hi>: me, te, eo auctore, <hi rend="ital">at my</hi>, <hi rend="ital">your</hi>, <hi rend="ital">his instance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by my</hi> <pb n="199" /> <cb n="AUCT" /> <hi rend="ital">advice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">command</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">non me quidem Faciet auctore, hodie ut illum decipiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an paenitebat flagiti, te auctore quod fecisset Adulescens?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare omnes istos me auctore deridete atque contemnite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:14:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 14, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia calida fomenta non proderant, frigidis curari coactus auctore Antonio Musā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:2 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 2 al.</bibl>: agis Carminibus grates et dis auctoribus horum, <hi rend="ital">the promoters</hi> or <hi rend="ital">authors of spells</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 148</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4420.11" n="2" level="3"> Esp., in political lang., t. t. </sense><sense id="n4420.12" n="a" level="4"> Auctor legis. </sense><sense id="n4420.13" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">One who proposes a law</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a mover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proposer</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quarum legum auctor fuerat, earum suasorem se haud dubium ferebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quid desperatius, qui ne ementiendo quidem potueris auctorem adumbrare meliorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:30:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 30, 80</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4420.14" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">One who advises the proposal of a law</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and exerts all his influence to have it passed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a supporter</hi> (stronger than suasor; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alium dicente, auctore eo Senatum se adīsse, verba mutare et pro auctore suasorem dicere coegit): isti rationi neque lator quisquam est inventus neque auctor umquam bonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:15:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 15, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ostenderem, si lex utilis plebi Romanae mihi videretur, auctorem me atque adjutorem futurum (esse),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo auctore societatem cum Perseo junxerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:11 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 11 al.</bibl>—Sometimes in connection with suasor: <cit><quote lang="la">atque hujus deditionis ipse Postumius suasor et auctor fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:30:109" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 30, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nisi quis retinet, idem suasor auctorque consilii ero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 2 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n4420.15" n="(g)" level="5"> Of a senate which accepts or adopts a proposition for a law, <hi rend="ital">a confirmer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ratifier</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc cum loquar apud senatores populi Romani, legum et judiciorum et juris auctores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 67</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a law-giver</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum ad civilia vertet Jura suum, legesque feret justissimus auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:833" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 833</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of one who establishes conditions of peace: leges captis justissimus auctor imposuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 101</bibl></cit>. —Hence, auctores fieri, <hi rend="ital">to approve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accept</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confirm a law</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum de plebe consulem non accipiebat, patres ante auctores fieri coëgerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:14:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 14, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Decreverunt ut, cum populus regem jussisset, id sic ratum esset, si patres auctores fierent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 54</bibl>; 2, 56; 6, 42; 8, 12 al.—</sense><sense id="n4420.16" n="b" level="4"> Auctor consilii publici, <hi rend="ital">he who has the chief voice in the senate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a leader</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc rei publicae rectorem et consilii publici auctorem esse habendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:48:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 48, 211</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 17, 63</bibl>. —Also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regem Ariobarzanem, cujus salutem a senatu te auctore, commendatam habebam,</quote> <trans><tr>by your influence</tr>, <tr>and the decree of the senate occasioned by it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. Gron. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 43</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4420.17" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">One who is an exemplar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a model</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pattern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">type of any thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caecilius, malus auctor Latinitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec litterarum Graecarum, nec philosophiae jam ullum auctorem requiro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Wopk. Lect. Tull. p. 34: unum cedo auctorem tui facti, unius profer exemplum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>who has done a similar thing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cato omnium virtutum auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:16:44 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 16, 44 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n4420.18" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">One that becomes security for something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a voucher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">witness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id ita esse ut credas, rem tibi auctorem dabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctorem rumorem habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: fama nuntiabat te esse in Syriā; <cit><quote lang="la">auctor erat nemo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non si mihi Juppiter auctor Spondeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravis quamvis magnae rei auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctorem levem, nec satis fidum super tantā re Patres rati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs auspicato deis auctoribus in aeternum condita,</quote> <trans><tr>under the guaranty of the gods</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 28</bibl></cit>.—Also with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctores sumus tutam ibi majestatem Romani nominis fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4420.19" n="F" level="1"> In judic. lang., t. t. </sense><sense id="n4420.20" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A seller</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vender</hi> (inasmuch as he warrants the right of possession of the thing to be sold, and transfers it to the purchaser; sometimes the jurists make a distinction between <hi rend="ital">auctor primus</hi> and <hi rend="ital">auctor secundus;</hi> the former is the seller himself, the latter the bail or security whom the former brings, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:2:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 2, 4</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Salmas. Mod. Usur. pp. 728 and 733): quod a malo auctore emīssent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctor fundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:52" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 1, 52</bibl>: Inpero (auctor <hi rend="ital">ego</hi> sum), ut tu me quoivis castrandum loces, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 73</bibl> Wagn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 2</bibl>, <cb n="AUCT" /> 12.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctor beneficii populi Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4420.21" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A guardian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trustee</hi> (of women and minors): <cit><quote lang="la">dos quam mulier nullo auctore dixisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majores nostri nullam ne privatam quidem rem agere feminas sine auctore voluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pupillus obligari tutori eo auctore non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:8:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 8, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4420.22" n="3" level="3"> In espousals, auctores are <hi rend="ital">the witnesses of the marriage contract</hi> (parents, brothers, guardians, relatives, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">nubit genero socrus, nullis auspicibus, nullis auctoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4420.23" n="G" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An agent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">factor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spokesman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intercessor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">champion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclarus iste auctor suae civitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Plancius) princeps inter suos... maximarum societatum auctor, plurimarum magister,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:13:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 13, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meae salutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:50:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 50, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doloris sui, querelarum, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>!*? In class. Lat. auctor is also used as <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eas aves, quibus auctoribus etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:15:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 15, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Et hostes aderant et (Theoxena) auctor mortis instabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctor ego (Juno) audendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 159</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:192" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 192</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 709</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 14, 110</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 968" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 968</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=29" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 29</bibl> Müll. The distinction which the grammarians, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 12, 159</bibl>, Prob. p. 1452 sq. P., and others make between auctor <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi> and auctrix, that auctrix would refer more to the lit. signif. of the verb, augeo, while auctor <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi> has more direct relation to the prevailing signif. of its noun, auctoritas, is unfounded.</sense></entryFree>
auctoramentum: <entryFree id="n4421" type="main" key="aucto_ra_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auctōrāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>auctoro</etym>. <sense id="n4421.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That which binds</hi> or <hi rend="ital">obliges to the performance of certain services;</hi> hence (in concr.), <hi rend="ital">a contract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stipulation</hi>: illius turpissimi auctoramenti (sc. gladiatorii) verba sunt; <cit><quote lang="la">uri, vinciri ferroque necari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 37" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 37</bibl></cit>.— More freq., </sense><sense id="n4421.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That for which one binds himself to some service</hi> or <hi rend="ital">duty</hi> (as that of soldiers, gladiators, etc.), <hi rend="ital">wages</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reward.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4421.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: est in illis ipsa merces, auctoramentum servitutis, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:42:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 42, 150</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rudiariis revocatis auctoramento centenūm milium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugulati civis Romani auctoramentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:28:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 28, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:66:3" default="NO">2, 66, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4421.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">reward</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum sine auctoramento malum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 69" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discriminis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eum.</author> Pan. ad Constant. 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
auctoritas: <entryFree id="n4422" type="main" key="aucto_ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auctōrĭtas</orth> (not <orth extent="full" lang="la">autōr-</orth> nor <orth extent="full" lang="la">authōr-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>auctor</etym>, acc. to the different signiff. of that word, <sense id="n4422.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a producing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">production</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invention</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: auctoramentum, sententia, judicium, consilium, vis, pondus, favor, gratia): quod si exquiratur usque ab stirpe auctoritas (sc. rumoris),</quote> <trans><tr>originator</tr>, <tr>inventor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus facti qui sint principes et inventores, qui denique auctoritatis ejus et inventionis comprobatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:28:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 28, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum poëtae Stoicos depravārint, an Stoici poëtis dederint auctoritatem, non facile dixerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:38:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 38, 91</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4422.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., </sense><sense id="n4422.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A view</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opinion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">judgment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">errat vehementer, si quis in orationibus nostris auctoritates nostras consignatas se habere arbitratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:50:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 50, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquum est, ut de Q. Catuli auctoritate et sententiā dicendum esse videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:chapter=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mihi quidem ex animo eximi non potest, esse deos, id tamen ipsum, quod mihi persuasum est auctoritate majorum, cur ita sit, nihil tu me doces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus apud me antiquorum auctoritas valet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 4, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4422.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Counsel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persuasion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encouragement</hi> to something (esp. if made with energy and sustained by the authority and influence of the counsellor; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">auctor, I. C.): auctoritatem defugere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jubeo, cogo atque impero. Numquam defugiam auctoritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 99</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.: attende jam, Torquate, quam ego defugiam auctoritatem consulatūs mei, <hi rend="ital">how little pleased</hi> (ironically) <hi rend="ital">I am that the occurrences of my consulship are ascribed to my exertions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">my influence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 11, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus (Reguli) cum valuisset auctoritas, captivi retenti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:27:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 27, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jure, legibus, auctoritate omnium, qui consulebantur, testamentum fecerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus (Sexti) mihi vivit auctoritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his rebus adducti et auctoritate Orgetorigis permoti etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: ut per auctoritatem<cb n="AUCT" />  earum civitatium suae preces nuper repudiatae faciliorem aditum ad senatum haberent, i. e. agentibus, intervenientibus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 3 al.</bibl>—Also <hi rend="ital">consolatory exhortation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consolation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comfort</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">his autem litteris animum tuum...amicissimi hominis auctoritate confirmandum etiam atque etiam puto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 6, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4422.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decision</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bidding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">command</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precept</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ad verba rem deflectere velimus, consilium autem eorum, qui scripserunt, et rationem et auctoritatem relinquamus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:18:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 18, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba servire hominum consiliis et auctoritatibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legio auctoritatem Caesaris persecuta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi legiones ad Caesaris auctoritatem se contulissent,</quote> <trans><tr>under his command</tr>, <tr>guidance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n4422.5" n="2" level="3"> Esp., in political lang., t. t. </sense><sense id="n4422.6" n="a" level="4"> Senatūs auctoritas, </sense><sense id="n4422.7" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The will of the senate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum Picenum contra senatūs auctoritatem dividere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 4, 11</bibl></cit>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n4422.8" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A decree of the senate</hi>, = Senatūs consultum: <cit><quote lang="la">Senatūs vetus auctoritas de Bacchanalibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:15:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 15, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine senatūs auctoritate foedus facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:30:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 30, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Senatūs auctoritas gravissima intercessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">responditque ita ex auctoritate senatūs consul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperio non populi jussu, non ex auctoritate patrum dato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neminem exulum nisi ex Senatūs auctoritate restituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citra senatūs populique auctoritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:28 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 28 al.</bibl></cit> —Hence the superscription to the decrees of the Senate: <cit><quote lang="la">SENATVS. CONSVLTI. AVCTORITAS., abbrev., S. C. A.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8</bibl></cit>.—Sometimes between senatūs auctoritas and senatūs consultum this distinction is to be made, that the former designates a decision of the senate, invalidated by the protestation of the tribune of the people or by the people themselves; <cit><quote lang="la">the latter, one that is passed without opposition,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 57</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4422.9" n="b" level="4"> Auctoritas populi, <hi rend="ital">the popular will</hi> or <hi rend="ital">decision</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">isti principes et sibi et ceteris populi universi auctoritati parendum esse fateantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:chapter=22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 22</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:62:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 62, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2, § 4</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n4422.10" n="c" level="4"> Auctoritas collegii (pontificum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 44</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 19</bibl> and 21.—</sense><sense id="n4422.11" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Liberty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ability</hi>, <hi rend="ital">power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">authority</hi> to do according to one's pleasure: <cit><quote lang="la">qui habet imperium a populo Romano auctoritatem legum dandarum ab senatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Verres tantum sibi auctoritatis in re publicā suscepit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 58</bibl></cit>: Invita in hoc loco versatur oratio; <cit><quote lang="la">videtur enim auctoritatem adferre peccandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:35:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 35, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Senatūs faciem secum attulerat auctoritatemque populi Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 8</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n4422.12" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Might</hi>, <hi rend="ital">power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">authority</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reputation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dignity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">influence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weight</hi> (very freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut vostra auctoritas Meae auctoritati fautrix adjutrixque sit, Ter. Hec. prol. alt. 40: aequitate causae et auctoritate suā aliquem commovere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id maximā auctoritate philosophi adfirmant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 29, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Digna est memoriā Q. Catuli cum auctoritas tum verecundia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:32" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimatium auctoritatem deminuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 11</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritatem habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:17:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 17, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adripere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:35:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 35, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to procure</tr>, <tr>obtain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:chapter=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 15</bibl></cit>: Grandis auctoritatis es et bene regis regnum Israël, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 21, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imminuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 22, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus capere auctoritatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:18:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 18, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quae sunt voluptates corporis cum auctoritatis praemiis comparandae?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18, 64</bibl></cit> et saep. —<usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to things, <hi rend="ital">importance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">significance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">value</hi>, <hi rend="ital">estimation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bos in pecuariā maximā debet esse auctoritate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt certa legum verba... quo plus auctoritatis habeant, paulo antiquiora,</quote> <trans><tr>more weight</tr>, <tr>force</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:7:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totius hujusce rei quae sit vis, quae auctoritas, quod pondus, ignorant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utilitatis species falsa ab honestatis auctoritate superata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:30:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 30, 109</bibl></cit>: cum antea per aetatem nondum hujus auctoritatem loci attingere auderem, <hi rend="ital">of this</hi> honorable <hi rend="ital">place</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the rostra</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bibliothecas omnium philosophorum mihi videtur XII. tabularum libellus auctoritatis pondere superare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:44:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 44, 195</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7</bibl>; Dolab. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> ib. 9, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritas praecipua lupo (pisci),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 17, 28, § 61</bibl></cit>: Post eum (Maecenatum) interiit auctoritas sapori (pullorum<pb n="200" /> <cb n="AUCT" />  asinorum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 43, 68, § 170</bibl> Jan: <cit><quote lang="la">unguentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 1, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritas dignitasque formae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 30</bibl></cit>.—Also of <hi rend="ital">feigned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assumed authority</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec cognovi quemquam, qui majore auctoritate nihil diceret,</quote> <trans><tr>that said nothing with a greater air of authority</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:67:139" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 67, 139</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4422.13" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An example</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pattern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">model</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium superiorum auctoritatem repudiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriā digna juventuti rei publicae capessendae auctoritas disciplinaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valuit auctoritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:22:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 22, 53</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 93</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu is es qui in disputando non tuum judicium sequare, sed auctoritati aliorum pareas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:13:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 13, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:6:16 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 6, 16 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n4422.14" n="G" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A warrant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">security for establishing a fact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assertion</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">credibility</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ea (justitia) sine prudentiā satis habeat auctoritatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:9:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 9, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desinant putare, auctoritatem esse in eo testimonio, cujus auctor inventus est nemo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 22, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quid vero habet auctoritatis furor iste, quem divinum vocatis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:54:110" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 54, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tollitur omnis auctoritas somniorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 59, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ad vanitatem accessit auctoritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 25, 94</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4422.15" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the things which serve for the verification</hi> or <hi rend="ital">establishment of a fact.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4422.16" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A record</hi>, <hi rend="ital">document</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">videt legationes, cum publicis auctoritatibus convenisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil putas valere in judiciis civitatum auctoritates ac litteras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 62</bibl></cit>, § 146.—</sense><sense id="n4422.17" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a person who is security for something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">authority</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum auctoritates principum conjurationis colligeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed tu auctoritates contemnis, ratione pugnas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:4:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit>.—Hence for the <hi rend="ital">names</hi> of persons present at the drawing up of a decree of the senate: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in auctoritatibus praescriptis exstat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: Senatūs consultum, quod tibi misi, factum est auctoritatesque perscriptae, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4422.18" n="H" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Right of possession</hi> (cf. auctor, II. F. 1.): <cit><quote lang="la">lex usum et auctoritatem fundi jubet esse biennium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:19:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 19, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usūs auctoritas fundi biennium est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:4:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 4, 23</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:26:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 26, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:chapter=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 7</bibl>; Lex Atin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 6</bibl>; cf. Hugo, Rechtsgesch. p. 217 sq.—So in the laws of the XII. Tables: ADVERSVS. HOSTEM. AETERNA. AVCTORITAS., <hi rend="ital">against a stranger the right of possession is perpetual</hi> (i. e. <hi rend="ital">a stranger cannot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by prescription</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtain the right of possession to the property of a Roman</hi>), ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 12, 37</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4422.19" n="J" level="1"> In jurid. lang., <hi rend="ital">a guaranty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">security</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 2, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
auctoro: <entryFree id="n4423" type="main" key="aucto_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auctōro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">auctōror</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:8:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:6:9" default="NO">27, 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 225, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Scap. 1</bibl>) [auctor]. <sense id="n4423.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To become security for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to give a pledge as bondsman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:6:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:8:4" default="NO">26, 8, 4</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, in the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">observatio satis auctorata consensūs patrocinio,</quote> <trans><tr>confirmed</tr>, <tr>supported</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cor. Mil. 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4423.1" n="II" level="1"> More freq. se auctorare, or <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> auctorari, <hi rend="ital">to bind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">oblige one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi> to something, <hi rend="ital">to hire one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self out</hi> for some service (mostly post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">never in Cic.): vindemitor auctoratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 10</bibl></cit>.—Esp. of gladiators: Quid refert, uri virgis ferroque necari Auctoratus eas, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 59</bibl> (qui se vendunt ludo (gladiatorio) auctorati vocantur; <cit><quote lang="la">auctoratio enim dicitur venditio gladiatorum, Acro): proximo munere inter novos auctoratos ferulis vapulare placet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Apocol.p.251" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Apocol.p.251</bibl></cit> Bip.: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoratus ob sepeliendum patrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 302" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 302</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4404</bibl>.—Hence, in the pun: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum magis auctoratum populum Romanum circumferens,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>brought into greater danger than the gladiators</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 117</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n4423.2" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to bind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo pignore velut auctoratum sibi proditorem ratus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 340</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n4423.3" n="C" level="2"> Sibi mortem aliquā re, <hi rend="ital">to bring death to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self by some means</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:30" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
auctoror: <entryFree id="n4424" type="main" key="aucto_ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auctōror</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, v. auctoro <sense id="n4424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
auctrix: <entryFree id="n4425" type="main" key="auctrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auctrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>auctor</etym>. <sense id="n4425.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">She that originates a thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an author</hi> (very rare, and post-class. for auctor, q. v. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">materia auctrix universitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Herm. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anima auctrix operum carnis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comoediae scelerum et libidinum auctrices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Spect. 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4425.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A female seller</hi> or <hi rend="ital">surety</hi> (very rare, and post-class.), Cod. Diocl. et Max. 8, 45, 16; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
auctumnalis: <entryFree id="n4426" type="main" key="auctumna_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auctumnālis</orth> (correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">aut-</orth>), <itype>e</itype> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">autumnal</orth>, <itype>related as facul to facile</itype>,<cb n="AUCT" />  volup to volupe, famul to famulus, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 94</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>auctumnus</etym>, <sense id="n4426.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the autumn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">autumnal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequinoctium autumnal, Varr. ap. Charis. l. l.: aequinoctium autumnale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:28" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aestuus) tumentes autumnali (aequinoctio) amplius quam verno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 97, 99, § 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus autumnale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:39:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 39, 1</bibl></cit>: lumen autumnale, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=285" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 285</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 4, 10, § 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 3, 13, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pruna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:2:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corna autumnalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:665" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 665</bibl></cit>, and 13, 816 et saep.</sense></entryFree>
auctumnescit: <entryFree id="n4427" type="hapax" key="auctumnescit"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auctumnescit</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-nascit</orth> (correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">aut-</orth>), <sense id="n4427.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. impers.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">autumn approaches</hi>, <hi rend="ital">is coming on</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, p. 196</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
auctumnitas: <entryFree id="n4428" type="main" key="auctumni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auctumnĭtas</orth> (correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">aut-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (only ante- and post-class.). <sense id="n4428.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The season of autumn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the autumn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harvest-time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Circum oleas autumnitate ablaqueato,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primā autumnitate cum pluvius est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 155, 1</bibl></cit>: autumnitas in anni tetrachordo mensem praeterierat, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 71, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestas atque autumnitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, p. 96</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4428.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The produce of autumn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the harvest</hi> (cf. 1. auctumnus, II.): dapem autumnitatis uvidam, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 71, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex olivis atque vinetis plenam faciant autumnitatem fundi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, p. 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
auctumno: <entryFree id="n4429" type="main" key="auctumno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auctumno</orth> (correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">aut-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n4429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cause</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bring on autumn</hi> (only in the two foll. exs.): <cit><quote lang="la">corus autumnat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 47, § 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër aestate nimbosā semper quodam modo vernat vel autumnat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 50, 51, § 136</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
auctumnus: <entryFree id="n4430" type="main" key="auctumnus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auctumnus</orth> (correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">aut-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">autumnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, Varr.ap.Non.p.71, 20). [This word was anciently referred to augeo, as the season of <sense id="n4430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">increase</hi>, as by Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=23:11" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 23, 11</bibl> Müll.; so Curtius. But Corssen and others, in view of its correct form, <hi rend="ital">autumnus</hi>, refer it to the Sanscr. av, to do good to, to satisfy one's self; cf. the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)nhnh/s</foreign> (i.e. <foreign lang="greek">e)nhvh/s</foreign>), good, kindly, and 2.aveo, to be well.] <hi rend="ital">The season of abundance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the autumn.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4430.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (from the 22d of September to the 22d of December; <cit><quote lang="la">acc. to the designation of the ancients, from the entering of the sun into Libra until the setting of the Pleiades, comprising 91 days,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:28" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 28</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">quae temporis quasi naturam notant, hiems, ver, aestas, autumnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:chapter=11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vites autumno fundi suadente videmus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Inde autumnus adit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:743" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 743</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pomifer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">varius purpureo colore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sordidus calcatis uvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 29</bibl></cit>: letifer, <hi rend="ital">sickly</hi> (on account of the diseases that prevail in autumn), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:56" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub autumno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 315</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">autumno adulto,</quote> <trans><tr>about the middle of autumn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vergente,</quote> <trans><tr>drawing to a close</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flexus autumni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:23 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 23 al.</bibl></cit>—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Frustra per autumnos nocentem Corporibus metuemus Austrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 117</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 327</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n4430.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the produce of the autumn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the harvest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et multa fragrat testa senibus autumnis, i. e. vino vetere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:58:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 58, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4431" type="main" key="auctumnus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auctumnus</orth> (correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">aut-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. auctumnus</etym>, <sense id="n4431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">autumnal</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">imber,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">autumno frigore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:729" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 729</bibl></cit> (Merk., <hi rend="ital">autumni frigore</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">sidera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 2, 269</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 425</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pruinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 8, 10</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Cod. Th. 2, 8, 2: aequinoctium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 33, § 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:7:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 7, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
auctus: <entryFree id="n4432" type="main" key="auctus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>augeo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4433" type="main" key="auctus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">auctus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>augeo</etym>, <sense id="n4433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an increasing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">augmenting; increase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">growth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundance</hi> (esp. freq. after the Aug. per.; not in Cic.; syn. incrementum; post-class. augmentum). </sense><sense id="n4433.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis auctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:482" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 482</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1171" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1171</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hic natura suis refrenat viribus auctum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 1121</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:846" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 846</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:327" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 327</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilium appellatum ab auctu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=90" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 90</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">vos (Divi Divaeque) bonis auctibus auxitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 24, § 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 19, 17, § 81</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: caedere arboris auctum, <hi rend="ital">the abundance of a tree</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">a large tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 168</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nec lorica tenet distenti corporis auctum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:797" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 797</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4433.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctus imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 33</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus viri fastigium tantis auctibus fortuna extulit ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:40:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 40, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum cotidiano auctu majus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:129" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 129 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: immensis auctibus aliquem extollere,<cb n="AUDA" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">augusta dicantur ab auctu, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>from the increase</tr>, <tr>enhancement of a prosperous condition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
aucupabundus: <entryFree id="n4434" type="hapax" key="aucu^pa_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aucŭpābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aucupor</etym>, = aucupans, <sense id="n4434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">watching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lurking for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aucupalis: <entryFree id="n4435" type="hapax" key="aucu^pa_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aucŭpālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aucupium</etym>, <sense id="n4435.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to vird-catching</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fowling</hi>: perticae, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=21" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 21</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
aucupatio: <entryFree id="n4436" type="main" key="aucu^pa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aucŭpātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>aucupor</etym>, <sense id="n4436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">birdcatching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fowling</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 13:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 13, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aucupatorius: <entryFree id="n4437" type="main" key="aucu^pa_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aucŭpātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n4437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">useful in bird-catching</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">harundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 66, § 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cum anno permansit inundatio, proficiunt in aucupatoriam amplitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 36, 66, § 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calami,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:218" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 218</bibl></cit>; Plin. l. l.</sense></entryFree>
aucupatus: <entryFree id="n4438" type="hapax" key="aucu^pa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aucŭpātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, = aucupium, <sense id="n4438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fowling</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Anton. Philos. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aucupium: <entryFree id="n4439" type="main" key="aucu^pi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aucŭpĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>auceps</etym>, <sense id="n4439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bird-catching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fowling.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4439.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscatu, aucupio, venatione, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:8:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 8, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Dec. 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctuae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sept. 12</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: aucupium sagittarum, <hi rend="ital">bird-taking with arrows</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">harundine sumptā Faunus plumoso sum deus aucupio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:2:34" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 2, 34</bibl></cit>; cf. Hermann. Opusc. III. p. 121.— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a catching at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lying in wait for something</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere aucupium auribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 44</bibl></cit> (cf. auceps and aucupor): <cit><quote lang="la">hoc novum est aucupium,</quote> <trans><tr>a new kind of fowling</tr>, <tr>new way of catching things</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 16</bibl></cit> (cf. the preced. verse, quaestus): <cit><quote lang="la">aucupium delectationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:25:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 25, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">58, 197</bibl>: aucupia verborum, <hi rend="ital">a catching at words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quibbling;</hi> cf. auceps, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:23:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 23, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomenclationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:31" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4439.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (abstr. for concr.), <hi rend="ital">the birds caught</hi>: qui tot res in se habet egregias, Aucupium, omne genus piscis, etc., * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:114:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 114, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aucupo: <entryFree id="n4440" type="main" key="aucu^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aucŭpo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. aucupor <sense id="n4440.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
aucupor: <entryFree id="n4441" type="main" key="aucu^por"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aucŭpor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> and <sense id="n4441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">act.</hi> [auceps], <hi rend="ital">to go bird-catching</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fowling.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4441.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alio loco ut seras ac colas silvam caeduam, alio ubi aucupare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:23:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R.
