R. 1, 23, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 1, 3</bibl>.—Also <hi rend="ital">of taking bees</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes aucupandi examina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:8:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 8, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4441.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to chase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give chase to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strive for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be on the look-out for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lie in wait for; watch for</hi>, etc. (a favorite figure in prose and poetry; in Cic. perh. twenty times; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: insidior, sequor): Viden scelestus ut aucupatur?</quote> <trans><tr>how he gives chase?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos longis navibus tranquillitates aucupaturi eramus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rosc Am. 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus imbecillitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 37, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omni ex genere orationem aucuper, et omnis undique flosculos carpam atque delibem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:56:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 56, 119</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">63, 256</bibl>; 19, 63; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:22:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 22, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Cassio omnes ramusculos popularis aurae aucupante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:16:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 16, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 6 al.</bibl>: occasionem, Auct. B. Afr. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: obtrectatione alienae scientiae famam sibi, Plin. H. N. praef. § 30; <cit><quote lang="la">33, 2, 8, § 32: studium populi ac favorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:13:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reconditas voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:86" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">absentiam alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 29, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 13, 107</bibl></cit>.!*? </sense><sense id="n4441.3" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> form <orth extent="full" lang="la">aucŭpo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <hi rend="ital">to watch for</hi>, etc.: fructus verborum aures aucupant, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 467, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prospectum aucupo, Pac. ib.: in consilio id reges Argivom aucupant, Att. ib.: id ego aucupavi, Titinn. ib.: Paulisper mane: Aucupemus ex insidiis clanculum quam rem gerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num quis est, Sermonem nostrum qui aucupet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 2, 42</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 483" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 483</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex insidiis aucupa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui aucupet me quid agam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lepide, mecastor, aucupavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 5, 72</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n4441.4" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> form aucupor: <cit><quote lang="la">Multa divulgata ac per rumorem vicissim aucupata discuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
audacia: <entryFree id="n4442" type="main" key="auda_ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">audācĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>audax</etym>, <sense id="n4442.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the quality of being</hi> audax, <hi rend="ital">boldness</hi>, in a good, but oftener in a bad sense (syn.: fortitudo, audentia, animus, virtus). </sense><sense id="n4442.1" n="I" level="1"> In a good sense, <hi rend="ital">daring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intrepidity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">valor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">audacia in bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audacia pro muro habetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 58:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 58, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frangere audaciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:38:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 38, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipso miraculo audaciae obstupefecit hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox aliis in audaciam, aliis ad formidinem opportuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unam in audaciā spem salutis (esse),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 49</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so Just. praef. 2, 9 al.: in audaces non est audacia tuta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10</bibl></cit>. <pb n="201" /> <cb n="AUDA" /> 544: <cit><quote lang="la">Quod si deficiant vires, audacia certe Laus erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:1:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumpsisset cor ejus audaciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 17, 6</bibl></cit> al.—</sense><sense id="n4442.2" n="II" level="1"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">daring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">audacity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">presumption</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temerity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insolence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impudence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">O hominis inpudentem audaciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 1, 13</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 72</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 5, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conpositis mendaciis Advenisti, audaciai columen,</quote> <trans><tr>shamelessness</tr>, <tr>impudence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tantāne adfectum quemquam esse hominem audaciā!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audacia non contrarium (fidentiae), sed appositum est ac propinquum et tamen vitium est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:54:165" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 54, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus paratus ad periculum, si suā cupiditate, non utilitate communi inpellitur, audaciae potius nomen habeat quam fortitudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:19:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 19, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incredibili importunitate et audaciā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audaciā et impudentiā fretus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 15</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 13</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:33 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 33 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 23, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:52:11" default="NO" valid="yes">52, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:61:1" default="NO" valid="yes">61, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:14:11 al" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 11 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 6 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 73 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:13" default="NO">8, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:12:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 12, 17</bibl> et saep. —In <number>plur.</number> (abstr. for concr.), <hi rend="ital">daring deeds</hi>, = audacter facta: <cit><quote lang="la">quantas audacias, quam incredibiles furores reperietis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: audacias Cato pluraliter dixit, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=27" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 27</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (formam vitae) postea celebrem miseriae temporum et audaciae temporum fecerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 74</bibl></cit>.—In a milder signif. <hi rend="ital">freedom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boldness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">licentia vel potius audacia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitare audaciam in translationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
audaciter: <entryFree id="n4443" type="main" key="auda_ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">audācĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. audax <sense id="n4443.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
audacter: <entryFree id="n4444" type="main" key="audacter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">audacter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. audax <sense id="n4444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
audaculus: <entryFree id="n4445" type="main" key="auda_cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">audācŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n4445.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [audax], <hi rend="ital">a little bold</hi> (rare, and post-class.), Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=23" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 23</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">reprehensor audaculus verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:21" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 21</bibl></cit>; Sulp. Apoll. ap. eund. 15, 5; Firm. 1 praef.</sense></entryFree>
audax: <entryFree id="n4446" type="main" key="audax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">audax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>from audeo, as ferax from fero, capax from capio</etym>, <sense id="n4446.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daring</hi>, in a good, but oftener in a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">bold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courageous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spirited; audacious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rash</hi>, <hi rend="ital">presumptuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foolhardy</hi> (syn.: fortis, temerarius). </sense><sense id="n4446.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n4446.2" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui me alter est audacior homo, aut qui me confidentior?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae non deliquit, decet Audacem esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 207</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o scelestum atque audacem hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">O hominem audacem!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 4, 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogitas, audacissime?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Verres homo audacissimus atque amentissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">temerarius et audax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petulans et audax,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Q. Fr. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii audaces, protervi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:18:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 18, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audaces, sibi placentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl></cit> Pet. 2, 10: <cit><quote lang="la">de improbis et audacibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentes quosdam eligit cum audacissimos tum viribus maximis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">da facilem cursum atque audacibus annue coeptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëta,</quote> <trans><tr>a poet who remains unmoved amid praise and blame</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 182</bibl></cit> Schmid: <cit><quote lang="la">audax Iapeti genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 3, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 27, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjunx timidi aut audacis Ulixis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:671" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 671</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furit audacissimus omni De numero Lycabas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:623" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 623</bibl></cit> al.—</sense><sense id="n4446.3" n="b" level="4"> Constr., </sense><sense id="n4446.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">viribus audax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audax juventā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:565" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 565</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4446.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">audax ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:2:64" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 2, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3, 135</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:495" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 10, 495</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:416" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 416</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4446.6" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">audax omnia perpeti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges inponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:5:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casus audax spondere secundos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 246</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4446.7" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad facinus audacior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4446.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to things: <cit><quote lang="la">audax facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 2, 3, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 3, 4</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:21:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 21, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes audacior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 7, § 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paupertas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dithyrambi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: verba, <hi rend="ital">bold</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">unusual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poetic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hyperbole audacioris ornatūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:223 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 223 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n4446.9" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">violent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fierce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proud</hi>: Nunc audax cave sis, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:50:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 50, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitiosus et audax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cerberus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:35" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:11:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 11, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hecate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 844" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 844</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boldly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courageously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">audaciously;</hi> in two forms, </sense><sense id="n4446.10" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">audācĭter</orth> (the original but unusual form; cf.: licet omnes oratores aliud sequantur, i. e. the form <hi rend="ital">audacter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 17</bibl>): <cb n="AUDE" /> Multa scelerate, multa audaciter, multa improbe fecisti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:36:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 36, 104</bibl> B. and K.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1014</bibl> P.; <cit><quote lang="la">Sall. H. Fragm. ap. Prisc. l. l.: audaciter se laturum fuisse de etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audaciter negantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 55</bibl></cit> Weissenb.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4446.11" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">audacter</orth> (the usu. class. form): <cit><quote lang="la">loquere audacter patri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audacter inter reges versari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:55:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 55, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 54</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:9:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 9, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 25, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:4" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:34:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 34, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:20:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Jud. 20, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:15:43 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Marc. 15, 43 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoi tuum concredat filium audacius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:8:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 8, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">60, 202</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 9, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:15:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 15, 15</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">audacissume oneris quid vis inpone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 3, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 30</bibl> (on these forms, v. Neue, Formenl. II. p. 661 sq.).</sense></entryFree>
audens: <entryFree id="n4447" type="main" key="audens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">audens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, v. <itype>audeo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
audenter: <entryFree id="n4448" type="main" key="audenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">audenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. audeo, <sense id="n4448.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
audentia: <entryFree id="n4449" type="main" key="audenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">audentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>audens</etym>, <sense id="n4449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">boldness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spirit</hi>, in a good sense (only postAug. and rare; syn.: audacia, animus). </sense><sense id="n4449.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">audacia et audentia hoc diversa sunt, quod audacia temeritatis est, audentia fortitudinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 431, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quisque audentiae habuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec defuit audentia Druso Germanico: sed obstitit Oceanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usurpatum raro et privatā cujusque audentiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4449.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">freedom in the use of words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">license</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si datur Homero et mollia vocabula et Graeca ad levitatem versus contrahere, extendere, inflectere, cur tibi similis audentia non detur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

hence freq. in the poets, and prose writers modelled after them, <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> sync. ausim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 6, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:18" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 18</bibl>; Prisc l. l.; Struve, p. 175 sq.; Ramsh. Gr. p. 140; Neue, Formenl. II. pp. 333 sq., 542, 547 sq. al.) [acc. to Pott, for avideo from avidus, pr. to be eager about something, to have spirit or courage for it; v. 1. aveo], <hi rend="ital">to venture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to venture to do</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dare; to be bold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courageous</hi> (with the idea of courage, boldness; while <hi rend="ital">conari</hi> designates a mere attempt, an undertaking; syn.: conor, molior); constr. with <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in with acc.</hi> or <case>abl.</case>, and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4450.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> (mostly in poets and histt., esp. in Tac.): <cit><quote lang="la">Quā audaciā tantum facinus audet?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 4, 37</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ut pessimum facinus auderent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 49</bibl>: quid domini faciant, audent cum talia furesl <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ausum talia deposcunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 199</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 244</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitalem fraudem ausi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:40" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:24:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 24, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">erant qui id flagitium formidine auderent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ausuros nocturnam castrorum oppugnationem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12</bibl></cit>; 4, 49; 11, 9; 12, 28; 14, 25; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 48</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 69</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 15 al.: ad audendum aliquid concitāsset, nisi etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:9 al" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 9 al.</bibl>; hence also <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa dolo, pleraque per vim audebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auderi adversus aliquem dimicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agenda res est audendaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:35:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 35, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:56" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 56 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patroni necem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 14</bibl></cit>.—Also <orth extent="full" lang="la">ausus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 67 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n4450.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (the usual constr.; <cit><quote lang="la">freq. both in prose and poetry): etiam audes meā revorti gratiā?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ecquid audes de tuo istuc addere?</quote> <trans><tr>do you undertake</tr>, <tr>venture upon?</tr></trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commovere me miser non audeo,</quote> <trans><tr>I venture not to stir</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neque tibi quicquam dare ausim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil jam muttire audeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 3, 2, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 1, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc ex ipsis caeli rationibus ausim confirmare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auderent credere gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1036" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 1036</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 68</bibl>; by <usg type="style">poet.</usg> license transf. to things: Vitigeni latices in aquaï fontibus audent Misceri, <hi rend="ital">the juice from the vine ventures boldly to intermingle with the water</hi>,<cb n="AUDI" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1072" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1072</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mithridates tantum victus efficere potuit, quantum incolumis numquam est ausus optare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperatorem deposcere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: ut de Ligarii (facto) non audeam confiteril <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 3, 8</bibl>: audeo dicere, <hi rend="ital">I dare say</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venture to assert</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">tolmw= le/gein</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:28:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 28, 84</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui pulsi loco cedere ausi erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 9, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem tu praeponere no bis Audes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:81:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 81, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">refrenare licentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vana contemnere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 17, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensuram prodere ausos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 1, 1, § 3 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sunt ausi persequi recedentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:35:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 35, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">44, 26</bibl>; ib. Job, 29, 22; 37, 24; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:22:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Matt. 22, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Act. 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Rom. 5, 7</bibl> et persaepe.—*</sense><sense id="n4450.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non audeam, quin promam omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4450.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in with acc.</hi> or <case>abl.</case> (eccl. Lat.): Rogo vos ne praesens audeam in quosdam (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)pi/ tinas</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 10, 2</bibl>: In quo quis audet, audeo et ego (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)n w\=(</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:11:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Cor. 11, 21</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Romani) audendo... magni facti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 4</bibl></cit> (n. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> Gerl.): <cit><quote lang="la">Nec nunc illi, quia audent, sed quia necesse est, pugnaturi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:40:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 40, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ejus modi consiliis periculosius esse deprehendi quam audere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo itinera audendi (esse), seu mallet statim arma, seu etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctor ego audendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nam spirat tragicum satis et feliciter audet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 166</bibl></cit>.—With an object to be supplied from the context: <cit><quote lang="la">hos vero novos magistros nihil intellegebam posse docere, nisi ut auderent (sc. dicere, orationes habere, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:24:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 24, 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 33</bibl> Frotsch.; 1, 5, 72: Judaei sub ipsos muros struxere aciem, rebus secundis longius ausuri (sc. progredi, <hi rend="ital">to advance further</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 11</bibl>: 2, 25, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 347</bibl>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, </sense><sense id="n4450.5" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">audens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">daring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intrepid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courageous;</hi> mostly in a good sense (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug prose): <cit><quote lang="la">tu ne cede malis, sed contra audentior ito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audentes deus ipse juvat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:586" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 586</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:608" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 608</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:782" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 782</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes audentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:284" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 284</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil gravius audenti quam ignavo patiendum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 2</bibl> audentissimi cujusque procursu. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 14 al.</bibl>— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">audenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">boldly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fearlessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rashly</hi>: liceat audenter dicere, — Vulg Act. 2, 29; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:2:29" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 2, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">audentius jam onerat Sejanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 68</bibl></cit> progressus, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumsistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inrupere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere fortius et audentius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or 18</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup</hi> prob not in use.—</sense><sense id="n4450.6" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ausus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">ventured</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attempted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undertaken</hi>, hence <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">au-sum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a daring attempt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a venture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an undertaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enterprise</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in postAug. prose; acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 12, 351</bibl>, perh. not before Verg.): <cit><quote lang="la">At tibi pro scelere, exclamat, pro talibus ausis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:535" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 535</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 351</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortia ausa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 281</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingentibus annuat ausis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 178</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 328</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 12</bibl>; 9, 621; 10, 460; 11, 242; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:49 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 14, 49 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:368" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 368</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ausum improbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 108, 112, § 147</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
audiens: <entryFree id="n4451" type="main" key="audi^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">audĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. audio.</entryFree>
audientia: <entryFree id="n4452" type="main" key="audi^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">audĭentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>audio</etym>, <sense id="n4452.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a listening</hi> to something; <hi rend="ital">audience</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attention;</hi> mostly in the phrase, audientiam facere, <hi rend="ital">to cause to give attention</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to procure a hearing.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4452.1" n="I" level="1"> Lit: exsurge, praeco; fac populo audientiam, i. e. <hi rend="ital">command silence</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 11</bibl>: Illi praeco faciebat audientiam, Auct ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 4, 55, 68</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">audientiam facere praeconem jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantam denique audientiam orationi meae improbitas illius factura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div in Caeeil. 13, 42</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:9:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 9, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:80:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 80, 325</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuere,</quote> <trans><tr>to give a hearing</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 131, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praebere, Cod. 7, 19, 7: impertiri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 13, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4452.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n4452.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The faculty of hearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hearing</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 954. —</sense><sense id="n4452.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The ears</hi> (abstr. for concr.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, p. 117</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5</bibl>, p. 178.</sense></entryFree>
audio: <entryFree id="n4453" type="main" key="audi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">audĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ii, itum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (<sense id="n4453.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imperf.</hi> audibat, Ov F. 3, 507: audibant. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:84:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 84, 8</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> audibo, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 506, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">audibis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 97</bibl>; Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; id. ap. Non. l. l.; cf. Struve, p. 137 sq.: audin = audisne, as ain = aisne; <hi rend="ital">inf. perf.</hi> audīsse better than audivisse, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 17</bibl>) (cf. the Lacon. <foreign lang="greek">au)=s</foreign> = <foreign lang="greek">ou(=s</foreign>; auris; Lith. ausis; Goth. auso; Germ. Ohr, and Engl ears <pb n="202" /> <cb n="AUDI" /> the Fr. ouïr, and Lat. ausculto; Curtius also compares the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)i+/w</foreign>, to hear, perceive, and the Sanscr. av, to notice, to favor; v. ausculto, 1. aveo <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>, and cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=83" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 83</bibl> Müll.], <hi rend="ital">to hear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to perceive</hi> or <hi rend="ital">understand by hearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to learn</hi> (audio pr. differs from ausculto as the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)kou/w</foreign> from <foreign lang="greek">a)kroa/omai</foreign>, the Germ. hören from horchen, and the Engl. to hear from to listen, the former of these words denoting an involuntary, the latter a voluntary act; other syn.: exaudio, sentio, cognosco, oboedio, dicor). </sense><sense id="n4453.1" n="I. A." level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n4453.2" n="a" level="4"> Aliquid: <cit><quote lang="la">auribus si parum audies terito cum vino brassicam, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi molarum strepitum audibis maximum, Enn. ap. Non. l. l. (Com. v. 7 Vahl. p. 153): verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:24:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 24, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae vera audivi, taceo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mane, non dum audīsti, Demea, Quod est gravissumum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vera an falsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 5, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mixtos vagitibus aegris Ploratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:579" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 579</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:439" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 439</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Matt. 2, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">strepitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:394" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 394</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 27, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 11, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:839" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 839</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 2, 24</bibl>: ait se omnia audivisse, Titinn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quod te audīsse dicis numquam audieris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:70:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 70, 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nihil enim habeo praeter auditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod quisque eorum de quāque re audierit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hac auditā pugnā maxima pars sese Crasso dedidit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Auditis hostium copiis respicerent suum ipsi exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:52:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 52, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod cum audīsset Abram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:14:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 14, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auditis sermonibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:22:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 4 Reg. 22, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Heb. 4, 3</bibl>: clangorem tubae, ib: <cit><quote lang="la">Isa. 18, 3: symphoniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:15:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Luc. 15, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Apoc. 6, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 5 al.</bibl> persaep. </sense><sense id="n4453.3" n="b" level="4"> Constr., the person from whom one hears or learns any thing, with <hi rend="ital">ex</hi> (so most freq.), <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acc. and part.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acc. and inf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cum</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dum.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4453.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum ex aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 2, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 4, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 3, 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">audivi ex majoribus natu hoc idem fuisse in P. Scipione Nasicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:109" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 30, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc ex aliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex obviis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 26</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:12 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 12 al.</bibl>. saepe audivi ex majoribus natu mirari solitum C. Fabricium etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:13:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 13, 43</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4453.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quibus cum audi/sset non multum superesse munitionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 7, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4453.6" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem saepe hoc audivi de patre et de socero meo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>from his mouth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:33:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 33, 133</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:19:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 19, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:26:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 26, 100</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4453.7" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi> (cf. Zumpt, Gr. § <cit><quote lang="la">636): ut neque eum querentem quisquam audierit neque etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timol. 4, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 9, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:125" default="NO" valid="yes">61, 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:67:41 al" default="NO" valid="yes">67, 41 al.</bibl>— (<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">acc. and inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi non credo, quom illaec autumare illum audio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 260</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Audin (eum) lapidem quaeritare?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erilem filium ejus duxisse audio Uxorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe hoc majores natu dicere audivi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gellius audierat patruom objurgare solere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:74:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 74, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 562</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">audiet cives acuisse ferrum, Audiet pugnas juventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:21 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 21 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audire videor pios Errare per lucos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 5</bibl></cit>. —Hence also <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">nom. and inf.</hi> (cf. Zumpt, Gr. § <cit><quote lang="la">607): Bibulus nondum audiebatur esse in Syriā,</quote> <trans><tr>was said</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 18</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 79</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dum</hi> (cf. Zumpt, Gr. § <cit><quote lang="la">749): id quidem saepe ex eo audivi, cum diceret sibi certum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:33:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 33, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis umquam audivit, cum ego de me nisi coactus ac necessario dicerem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 35</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:19:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 19, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:28:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 28, 129</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 24, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auditus est certe, dum ex eo quaerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 4</bibl></cit>. —Diff. from the preced. constr. with <hi rend="ital">de</hi> is audire de aliquo (aliquid); more freq. in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> sense, <hi rend="ital">to hear</hi> any thing <hi rend="ital">concerning any one</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de psaltriā hac audivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illos etiam convenire aveo, de quibus audivi et legi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 23, 83</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 2, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>to hear something against</tr>, <tr>something bad of any one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:70:285 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 70, 285 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n4453.8" n="B" level="2"> In conversation. </sense><sense id="n4453.9" n="(a)" level="5"> Audi, as a call to gain attention, <hi rend="ital">hear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give ear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">listen</hi>, = hoc age: <cit><quote lang="la">audi cetera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audi heus tu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dorio, audi, obsecro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: Hoc audi, id. And. <cb n="AUDI" /> 3, 4, 11; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 1, 36: Quin tu audi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin tu hoc audi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4453.10" n="(b)" level="5"> Audis or audin = audisne? <hi rend="ital">do you hear?</hi> atque audin? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Equidem deciens dixi: Et domi [nunc] sum ego, inquam, ecquid audis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 1, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Heus, audin quid ait? Quin fugis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura adversandum atque audin? quadrupedem constringito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 2, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 5, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Audin tu? Hic furti se adligat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Audin quid dicam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4453.11" n="c" level="4"> Audito, with a clause for its subject, as <hi rend="ital">abl. absol.</hi> in the histt., <hi rend="ital">upon the receipt of the news that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the tidings that</hi>: audito, Q. Marcium in Ciliciam tendere, <hi rend="ital">when news came that Q. Marcius</hi> etc., Sall. H. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1130</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">audito Machanidam famā adventūs sui territum refugisse Lacedaemonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audito venisse missu Agrippinae nuntium Agerinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4453.12" n="II" level="1"> Esp., </sense><sense id="n4453.13" n="A. 1." level="1"> In a pregnant signif., <hi rend="ital">to listen to</hi> a person or thing, <hi rend="ital">to give ear to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hearken to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">etsi a vobis sic audior, ut numquam benignius neque attentius quemquam auditum putem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:23:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 23, 63</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:61:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 61, 259</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed non eis animis audiebantur, qui doceri possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut legationes audiret cubans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job. 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:33:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Psa. 33, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Matt. 10, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:3:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Heb. 3, 7 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n4453.14" n="2" level="3"> Aliquem, of pupils, <hi rend="ital">to hear a teacher</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to receive instruction from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to study under</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te, Marce fili, annum jam audientem Cratippum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jam Polemonem audiverant adsidue Zeno et Arcesilas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 9, 34</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:14:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 14, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diogenes venientem eum, ut se extra ordinem audiret, non admiserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:10:20 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 10, 20 al.</bibl>—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: possumne aliquid audire? (i. e. <hi rend="ital">will you communicate something to me?</hi>) tu vero, inquam, vel audire vel dicere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponere aliquid, ad quod audiam, volo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4453.15" n="3" level="3"> De aliquā re or aliquid, aliquem, of judges, <hi rend="ital">to listen</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hearken to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to examine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo illorum judicum clarissimis viris accusantibus audiendum sibi de ambitu putavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 39, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de capite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:12 al" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 12 al.</bibl></cit> —<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">de pace,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:567" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 567</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequissimum servum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 11</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:3:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 3, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:6:10" default="NO">28, 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:18" default="NO">39, 2, 18</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n4453.16" n="4" level="3"> Of prayer or entreaty, <hi rend="ital">to hear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">listen to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lend an ear to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo di immortales meas preces audiverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Curio ubi ... neque cohortationes suas neque preces audiri intellegit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut si sensisset auditas preces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audivit orationem eorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:105:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 105, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audisti verba oris mei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> ib. 137, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Audiat aversā non meus aure deus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:3:28" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audiit et caeli Genitor de parte serenā Intonuit laevum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:630" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 630</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minus audientem carmina Vestam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 13, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">audivit Dominus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:29:11 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 29, 11 al.</bibl></cit>—Also aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to hear one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grant his desire or prayer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puellas ter vocata audis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 22, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> C. S. 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ferreus orantem nequiquam, janitor, audis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 6, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:598 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 598 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Audi nos, domine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 23, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">23, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper me audis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:11:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Joan. 11, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4453.17" n="B" level="2"> Aliquem, aliquid, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> audio, <hi rend="ital">to hear a person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing with approbation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to assent to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agree with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">approve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec Homerum audio, qui Ganymeden ab dis raptum ait, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:26:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 26, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Socratem audio dicentem cibi condimentum esse famem, sed qui ad voluptatem omnia referens vivit ut Gallonius, non audio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:28:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 28, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:15:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 15, 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 28, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 8, 25</bibl>: audio (<hi rend="ital">I grant it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that I agree to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that is granted</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">nunc dicis aliquid, quod ad rem pertineat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non audio,</quote> <trans><tr>that I do not grant</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4453.18" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To hear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to listen to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to obey</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heed;</hi> orig. and class. only with <case>acc.</case>, but also with <case>dat.</case>—</sense><sense id="n4453.19" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecum loquere, te adhibe in consilium, te audi, tibi obtempera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne ego sapientiam istam, quamvis sit erudita, non audiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si me audiatis, priusquam dedantur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Non, si me satis audias, Speres etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C.1, 13, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 14, 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patris aut matris imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:21:18 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 21, 18 al.</bibl></cit>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> <cb n="AUDI" /> transf. to inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">neque audit currus habenas,</quote> <trans><tr>heeds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:514" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 514</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 187</bibl> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 13</bibl>: equi frenato est auris in ore; and Pind. Pyth. 2, 21: <foreign lang="greek">a(/rmata peisixa/lina</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">nec minus incerta (sagitta) est, nec quae magis audiat arcum,</quote> <trans><tr>which better heeds the bow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 382</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teque languenti manu Non audit arcus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 980" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 980</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:412" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 412</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:594" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 594</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:931" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 931</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:392" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 392</bibl>. <orth extent="full" lang="la">—</orth>;</sense><sense id="n4453.20" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: nam istis qui linguam avium intellegunt, magis audiendum censeo, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:57:131" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 57, 131</bibl> (B. and K. <hi rend="ital">isti</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">sibi audire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 326, 34</bibl></cit>; so, dicto audientem esse, <hi rend="ital">to listen to</hi> one's <hi rend="ital">word</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be obedient to</hi> one's <hi rend="ital">word</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to obey</hi> (not in Ter.): <cit><quote lang="la">dicto sum audiens,</quote> <trans><tr>I obey</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 1, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3, 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui dicto audientes in tantā re non fuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 8, 23</bibl></cit>' sunt illi quidem dicto audientes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos dicto audientes jussi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 104</bibl></cit>.—And, on account of the signif. <hi rend="ital">to obey</hi>, with a second personal <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: dicto audientem esse alicui, <hi rend="ital">to obey one</hi> (freq. and class.); cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Stallb. ad Rudd. Gr. II. p. 124, n. 38: vilicus domino dicto audiens sit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 142</bibl></cit>: si habes, qui te audiat; <cit><quote lang="la">si potest tibi dicto audiens esse quisquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4</bibl>. 12; 2, 5, 32; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicto audiens fuit jussis absentium magistratuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lys. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Iphicr. 2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Iphicr. 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">interim Servio Tullio jubere populum dicto audientem esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:20" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 20</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">41, 10 al.—Once pleon. with oboedio: ne plebs nobis dicto audiens atque oboediens sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4453.21" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To hear thus and thus</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be named</hi> or <hi rend="ital">styled somehow</hi> (as in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)kou/w</foreign>; and in Engl. to hear, as Milton: Or hear'st thou rather pure ethereal stream, P. L. III. 7); and with <hi rend="ital">bene</hi> or <hi rend="ital">male</hi> (as in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kalw=s</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">kakw=s a)kou/ein</foreign>; cf. Milton: For which Britain hears ill abroad, Areop.; and Spenser: If old Aveugles sonnes so evil hear, F. Q.
