I. 5, 23), <hi rend="ital">to be in good</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bad repute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be praised</hi> or <hi rend="ital">blamed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have a good</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bad character</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">benedictis si certāsset, audīsset bene (Bene audire est bene dici, laudari, Don.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. prol. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu recte vivis, si curas esse quod audis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rexque paterque Audisti coram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7, 38</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 6, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:17:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 17, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ille, qui jejunus a quibusdam et aridus habetur, non aliter ab ipsis inimicis male audire quam nimiis floribus et ingenii afluentia potuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:13 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 13 al.</bibl></cit>—In a play upon words: erat surdaster M. Crassus; <cit><quote lang="la">sed aliud molestius quod male audiebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:40:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 40, 116</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">minus commode: quod illorum culpā se minus commode audire arbitrarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4453.22" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">As it were to hear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hear mentally</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to understand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to supply</hi>, something (later subaudio): cum subtractum verbum aliquod satis ex ceteris intellegitur, ut, stupere gaudio Graecus. Simul enim auditur <hi rend="ital">coepit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">is understood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">is to be supplied</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:58" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:12" default="NO">8, 5, 12</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">audĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a. subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4453.23" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to II. A.) <hi rend="ital">A hearer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">auditor</hi> ( = auditor, q. v., or qui audit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:80:276" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 80, 276</bibl>)' ad animos audientium permovendos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:23:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 23, 89</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">80, 279</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum adsensu audientium egit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:10 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 10 al.</bibl></cit>—Hence, in eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">a catechumen</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Poen. 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4453.24" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to II. C.) With the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: tibi servio atque audiens sum imperii, <hi rend="ital">a hearer of</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">obedient to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">your command</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
auditavi: <entryFree id="n4454" type="gloss" key="audi_ta_vi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">audītāvi</orth>: saepe audivi, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=24" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 24</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
auditio: <entryFree id="n4455" type="main" key="audi_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">audītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>audio</etym>. <sense id="n4455.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A hearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a listening to</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">auditus, auscultatio): (pueri) fabellarum auditione ducuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:15:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui est versatus in auditione et cogitatione, quae studio et diligentiā praecurrit aetatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:30:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 30, 131</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:10" default="NO">10, 1, 10</bibl>: audite auditionem in terrore vocis ejus, <hi rend="ital">hear a hearing</hi> (after the Heb.), i. e. hear attentively, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 37, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4455.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Hearsay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc solum auditione expetere coepit, cum id ipse non vidisset?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 46</bibl></cit>.—Hence, meton., </sense><sense id="n4455.2" n="(a)" level="5"> (Abstr. pro concr.) <hi rend="ital">A report</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hearsay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">news</hi> (also in <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">si accepissent famā et auditione esse quoddam numen et vim deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:37:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 37, 95</bibl></cit>: fictae auditiones, <pb n="203" /> <cb n="AUFE" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:23:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 23, 56</bibl>: ne tenuissimam quidem auditionem de eā re accepi, <hi rend="ital">not even the slightest inkling</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">His rebus atque auditionibus permoti etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsae auditiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab auditione malā non timebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:111:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 111, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,042:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Nah. 3, 19</bibl>.— And </sense><sense id="n4455.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Effect for cause, <hi rend="ital">the voice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Domine, audivi auditionem tuam et timui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,043:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Hab. 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4455.4" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The hearing of a pupil</hi> (cf. audio, II. A. 2.); hence, meton. (abstr. pro concr.), <hi rend="ital">a lecture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lesson</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discourse</hi> (perh. only post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Sedere in scholis auditioni operatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 2, 6, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egressus ex auditione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:2" default="NO">18, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:8" default="NO">19, 8</bibl>.—*</sense><sense id="n4455.5" n="IV" level="1"> For auditus, <hi rend="ital">the sense of hearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the hearing</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. p. 9, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
auditiuncula: <entryFree id="n4456" type="hapax" key="audi_ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">audītĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>auditio</etym>, <sense id="n4456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a brief discourse</hi> (cf. auditio, III.): <cit><quote lang="la">auditiunculā quādam de Catonis familiā aspersus es,</quote> <trans><tr>with some little account of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:20:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 20, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
auditor: <entryFree id="n4457" type="main" key="audi_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">audītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>audio</etym>, <sense id="n4457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hearer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an auditor</hi> (syn.: qui audit, discipulus). </sense><sense id="n4457.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:8:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 8, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">35, 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:51:191" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 51, 191</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:86" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 24, 4</bibl>; ib. Job, 31, 35; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Rom. 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,020:1:22 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Jac. 1, 22 al.</bibl> (auditores in Cic. is freq. periphrased by qui audiunt, Sest. 44; de Or. 1, 5, 17; 1, 51, 219).—</sense><sense id="n4457.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">one that hears a teacher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pupil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scholar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disciple</hi> (cf. audio, II. A. 2.): <cit><quote lang="la">Demetrius Phalereus Theophrasti auditor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:19:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 19, 54</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:15:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 15, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 9, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:42:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 42, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 4:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 4, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:2:35" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 2, 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4457.3" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>; Varro uses auditor once of <hi rend="ital">a reader of a book</hi>, as analogous to the hearing of an oral discourse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 1</bibl> Müll. (so vox of <hi rend="ital">a writer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inconditā ac rudi voce memoriam servitutis composuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">epistolis obtundere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 1, 4</bibl></cit>).</sense></entryFree>
auditorialis: <entryFree id="n4458" type="main" key="audi_to_ri^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">audītōrĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>auditorium</etym>, <sense id="n4458.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a school</hi> (post-class.): scholastici, Aug. c. Pelag. 6, 11.</sense></entryFree>
auditorius: <entryFree id="n4459" type="main" key="audi_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">audītōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>auditor</etym>, <sense id="n4459.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">relating to a hearer</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hearing.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4459.1" n="I" level="1"> As <pos>adj.</pos> only once: <cit><quote lang="la">cavernae,</quote> <trans><tr>the auditory passages</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:3" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n4459.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">audītōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n4459.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A hearing of a cause at law</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a judicial examination</hi> (cf. audio, II. A. 3.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:8:41" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 8, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4459.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The place where something</hi> (a discourse, a lecture) <hi rend="ital">is heard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lecture-room</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hall of justice</hi> (not in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. in gen. not before the Aug. period): cujus rei gratiā plenum sit auditorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:11:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum mutuatur et auditorium exstruit etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonnulla in coetu familiarium velut in auditorio recitavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:85" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rhet. 6</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:25:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 25, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:1:54" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 1, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:9:1" default="NO">49, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4" default="NO">4, 4</bibl>. 18 al.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of the forum: <cit><quote lang="la">non rudibus dimicantes nec auditorium semper plenum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4459.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A school</hi>, in opp. to public life: <cit><quote lang="la">condicio fori et auditorii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4459.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The assembled hearers themselves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the audience</hi>, <hi rend="ital">auditory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuper adhibito ingenti auditorio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 7</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 320, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
auditus: <entryFree id="n4460" type="main" key="audi_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">audītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of audio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4461" type="main" key="audi_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">audītus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>audio</etym>. <sense id="n4461.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A hearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">listening</hi> (so perh. only post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: auditio, auscultatio): ea plurium auditu accipi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">breviauditu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auditus auris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:22:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 22, 45</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">ib. Job, 42, 5: auditu audietis (by Hebraïsm),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Matt. 13, 14</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">the instruction listened to</hi> (cf. audio, II. A. 2.): <cit><quote lang="la">quis dignior umquam Hoc fuit auditu?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 183</bibl></cit>.— Also (like auditio, II.), <hi rend="ital">a rumor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">report</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">occupaverat animos prior auditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quis credidit auditui nostro?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:12:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Joan. 12, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:10:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Rom. 10, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4461.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The sense of hearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the hearing</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">auditus autem semper patet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:144" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 144</bibl></cit>: num quid aliquo sensu perceptum sit, aspectu, auditu, tactu, odore, gustatu, Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures acerrimi auditūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 32, 50, § 114</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:85" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 4, 42, § 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Si totum corpus oculus, ubi auditus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:12:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 12, 17</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">bis.</hi> al. —In <number>plur.</number>: auditus hominum deorumque mulcens, i. e. aures, App Dogm. Plat. 1.</sense></entryFree>
aufeius: <entryFree id="n4462" type="main" key="Aufe_ius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Aufēius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n4462.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the</hi> gens Aufeia: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 24, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex (A. U. C. 630), named after a tribune of the people, Aufeius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. Meyer, Orat. Fragm. p. 121.</sense></entryFree>
aufero: <entryFree id="n4463" type="main" key="aufe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aufĕro</orth>, <itype>abstŭli, ablātum, auferre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ab-fero; cf. ab <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></etym>, <sense id="n4463.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bear off</hi> or <cb n="AUFE" /> <hi rend="ital">away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to carry off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withdraw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi> (very freq. in prose and poetry; syn.: tollo, fero, rapio, eripio, diripio, adimo, averto). </sense><sense id="n4463.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n4463.2" n="A. 1." level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab januā stercus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. prol. 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum atque ornamenta abs te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abstulit eos a conspectu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:17:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 4 Reg. 17, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auferas me de terrā hac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:47:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Gen. 47, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos istaec intro auferte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Auferte ista hinc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Joan. 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aether multos secum levis abstulit ignīs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:459" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 459</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:230" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 230</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:439" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 439</bibl>; 3, 717; 5, 205; 5, 725; 6, 622; Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 422, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa domum suam auferebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberi per delectus alibi servituri auferuntur (a Romanis),</quote> <trans><tr>are carried away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem vi abstulerant servi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:21:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 21, 25</bibl></cit>.—So of sick persons, or those unable to walk: <cit><quote lang="la">auferere, non abibis, si ego fustem sumpsero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 202</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 298</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumbifragium hinc auferes): asoti, qui in mensam vomant et qui de conviviis auferantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:8:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 8, 23</bibl></cit>. —Auferre se, in colloquial lang., <hi rend="ital">to remove one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to withdraw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Te, obsecro hercle, aufer modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aufer te domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 4, 63</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n4463.3" n="2" level="3"> Of bodies that are borne away by wings, by the winds, waves, or any other quick motion, <hi rend="ital">to bear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carry away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sweep away</hi>, etc. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad scopulum e tranquillo auferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unda rates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:8:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auferor in scopulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:593" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 593</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auferet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:292" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 292</bibl></cit> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">in silvam pennis ablata refugit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 258</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 867</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne te citus auferat axis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vento secundo vehementi satis profecti celeriter e conspectu terrae ablati sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Bubo) volat numquam quo libuit, sed transversus aufertur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 12, 16, § 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(milites) pavore fugientium auferebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4463.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to carry away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mislead</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te hortor, ut omnia gubernes prudentiā tuā, ne te auferant aliorum consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abstulerunt me velut de spatio Graecae res immixtae Romanis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>have diverted</tr>, <tr>withdrawn me</tr>, <tr>from the subject</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae contemplatio aufert nos ad ipsorum animalium naturas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 13, 120, § 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auferre aliquem traversum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit> Jan: <cit><quote lang="la">ab intentione auferendus auditor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnus aufert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auferimur cultu, i. e. decipimur,</quote> <trans><tr>are deceived</tr>, <tr>duped</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 343</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4463.5" n="II" level="1"> Esp., </sense><sense id="n4463.6" n="A. 1." level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To take</hi> or <hi rend="ital">snatch away;</hi> in a good, but more frequently in a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">to take by force</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to remove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withdraw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take away violently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rob</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steal</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid eris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod auri, quod argenti, quod ornamentorum in meis urbibus fuit, id mihi tu, C. Verres, eripuisti atque abstulisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab hoc abaci vasa omnia abstuiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 16</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam de aerario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam in ventre,</quote> <trans><tr>to eat up</tr>, <tr>to squander</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:66:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 66, 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auriculam mordicus,</quote> <trans><tr>to bite off</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Q. Fr. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestimentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 6, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi ludi dies quindecim auferent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:10:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium indignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatum, censuram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auferat omnia irrita oblivio si potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem, voluntatem defensionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fervorem et audaciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsequia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">misericordiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem veniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 14, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:19 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 19 sq.</bibl></cit>; and so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 12, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">metus,</quote> <trans><tr>to banish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:316" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 316</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 16, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 5, 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:617" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 617</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugam,</quote> <trans><tr>to hinder</tr>, <tr>prevent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:10:3 al" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 10, 3 al.</bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n4463.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To take off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to destroy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slay</hi>, etc. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in the Aug. histt.): <cit><quote lang="la">Tam bellum mihi passerem abstulistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abstulit clarum cita mors Achillem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 29</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 5, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 9, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Auferat hora duos eadem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:709" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 709</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 157</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Labienum Varumque acies abstulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:55" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 55 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quidquid hinc aut illinc communis Mors belli aufert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:17:9 al" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 17, 9 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Interea quodcumque fuit populabile flammae, Mulciber abstulerat,</quote> <trans><tr>had consumed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 263</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 575</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4463.8" n="3" level="3"> Of places, <hi rend="ital">to separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divide</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare septem stadiorum intervallo Europam auferens Asiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 24, § 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Armenia Euphrate amne aufertur Cappadociae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 9, 9, § 25</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n4463.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To lay aside some action</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manner of</hi> <cb n="AUGE" /> <hi rend="ital">speaking</hi>, etc.; <hi rend="ital">to cease from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desist from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leave off</hi>: proinde istaec tua aufer terricula, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 227, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurgium hinc auferas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aufer nugas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pollicitationes aufer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Ge.</hi> Id nosmet ipsos facere oportet, Phaedria. <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Aufer mi "oportet:" quin tu, quod faciam, impera, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 45</bibl> Ruhnk. (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:170" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 170</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">Aufer abhinc lacrimas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:955" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 955</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insolentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 6, 8</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: Insanis? Aufer! <hi rend="ital">away!</hi> (where nugas may be supplied, as in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 4, 8</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 14</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> as object: <cit><quote lang="la">aufer Me vultu terrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4463.10" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, effect for cause, <hi rend="ital">to corry off</hi> (<hi rend="ital">as the fruit</hi> or <hi rend="ital">result of one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s labor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exertions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">errors</hi>, etc.), <hi rend="ital">to obtain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get</hi>, <hi rend="ital">receive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ecquas viginti minas Paritas ut auferas a me?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 5, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 4, 1, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id inultum numquam auferet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 3, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 8</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 2, 4</bibl>): paucos dies ab aliquo, <hi rend="ital">to obtain a few days</hi>' <hi rend="ital">respite</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,001:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Quinct. 5, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis umquam ad arbitrum quantum petiit, tantum abstulit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 4, 12</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">responsum ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:56:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 56, 239</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit>, A: <cit><quote lang="la">diploma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 17</bibl></cit>. —Also with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: ut in foro statuerent (statuas), abstulisti, <hi rend="ital">you have carried the point that they</hi> etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 59</bibl> (so, adsequi, ut, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 35</bibl>).—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to carry away the knowledge of a thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to learn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">understand</hi>: quis est in populo Romano, qui hoc non ex priore actione abstulerit? <hi rend="ital">has not learned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">does not know</hi>, Cic Verr. 2, 1, 8.</sense></entryFree>
aufidena: <entryFree id="n4464" type="main" key="Aufi^de_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Aufĭdēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*au)fi/dhna</foreign>, <sense id="n4464.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Samnium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the river Sagrus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Alfidena</hi>, Liv 10, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Aufĭdēnātes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">its inhabitants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 107</bibl>; cf. Mann. Ital. I p. 801.</sense></entryFree>
aufidius: <entryFree id="n4465" type="main" key="Aufi^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Aufĭdĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n4465.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens; hence, </sense><sense id="n4465.1" n="I" level="1"> Cn. Aufidius, <hi rend="ital">a contemporary of Cicero</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but older</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and the author of a Greek history</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:38:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 38, 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:19:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 19, 54</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4465.2" n="II" level="1"> T. Aufidius, <hi rend="ital">a Roman orator</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:48:179" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 48, 179</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n4465.3" n="III" level="1"> Sext. Aufidius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 26</bibl> and 27.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Aufĭdĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Aufidian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <trans><tr>the debt of Aufidius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4465.4" n="IV" level="1"> Aufidius Luscus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aufidus: <entryFree id="n4466" type="main" key="Aufi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Aufĭdus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*au)/fidos</foreign>, <sense id="n4466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Apulia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remarkable for its swift and violent course</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Ofanto</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe sonans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">violens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 30, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 1, 58</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">on account of its divided outlet: tauriformis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 14, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. Mann. Ital. II. p. 30 sq.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Aufĭ-dus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Aufidus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stagna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:171" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 171</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aufugio: <entryFree id="n4467" type="main" key="aufu^gi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aufŭgĭo</orth>, <itype>fūgi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>ab-fugio; cf. ab <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></etym>, <sense id="n4467.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to flee</hi> or <hi rend="ital">run away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flee from</hi> (very rare, but class.; not used by Catull., Tib., Lucr., Verg., Hor., or Ovid, nor by Sall., and used only twice in Cic. Oratt., and once in Tac.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: fugio, effugio, diffugio): quā plateā hinc aufugerim?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tum aquam aufugisse dicito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">denique hercle aufugerim Potius quam redeam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter impudentissimum furtum aufugerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si aufugisset (archipirata),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum multos libros surripuisset, aufugit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fam 13, 77</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Q. Fr. 1, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex eo loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspectum parentis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D 2, 43, 111</bibl></cit> B. and K: <cit><quote lang="la">blanditias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:9:30" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 9, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec Sisenna vim metuens aufugeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: Aufugit mihi animus, Q. Cat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
auge: <entryFree id="n4468" type="main" key="Auge_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Augē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, f., = <foreign lang="greek">*au)/gh</foreign>. <sense id="n4468.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Daughter of Aleus and Neœra of Tegea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Arcadia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and mother of Telephus by Hercules</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 367" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 367</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. E. 6, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 101" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 101</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4468.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the Horœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 183" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 183</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
augeas: <entryFree id="n4469" type="main" key="Auge_as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Augēas</orth>, v. Augias.</entryFree>
augeo: <entryFree id="n4470" type="main" key="auge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">augĕo</orth>, <itype>auxi, auctum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> (<sense id="n4470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf subj.</hi> auxitis = auxeritis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 27</bibl>: auceta: saepe aucta, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=25" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 25</bibl> Müll.; v. Müll. ad h. l.) [Gr. <foreign lang="greek">au)/cw au)ca/nw</foreign>; Lith. augu, and augmu = growth; Sanscr. vaksh; Goth. vahsjan, and auka = growth; Germ. wachsen; Engl. wax; also allied to vegeo vegetus, vigeo vigor, vigil <pb n="204" /> <cb n="AUGE" /> v. Curt. pp. 67, 186 sq., and Bopp, Gloss. p. 304 b]. </sense><sense id="n4470.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to increase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to nourish</hi> (orig., to produce, bring forth that not already in existence; in which signification only the derivative auctor is now found). </sense><sense id="n4470.2" n="A. 1." level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To increase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enlarge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">augment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strengthen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advance that which is already in existence</hi> (class. in prose and poetry; syn.: adaugeo, amplio, amplifico): Quicquid est hoc, omnia animat, format, alit, auget, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:57:131" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 57, 131</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibus auget corpus alitque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:859" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 859</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">redductum (animale genus) daedala tellus alit atque auget generatim pabula praebens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 229</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:220" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 220</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:322" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 322</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">6, 946: virīs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:342" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 342</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in augendā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in augendā obruitur re,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem strenuus auge,</quote> <trans><tr>increase your gains</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">possessiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov 22, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dotem et munera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:34:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Gen. 34, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam agris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 18</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> H 1, 79</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aerarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallum et turres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tributa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:16:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 16, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 37</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:20:19 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 20, 19 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspitionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">industriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:prol. 25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. prol. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molestiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 22</bibl></cit> vitium ventris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:9:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 9, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:32:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Num. 32, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">benevolentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 9, 30</bibl></cit>: animum alicujus, <hi rend="ital">to increase one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s courage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 14</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:23" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem,</quote> <trans><tr>to strengthen</tr>, <tr>raise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 20</bibl>' hostias, <hi rend="ital">to increase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">multiply</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego te augebo et multiplicabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:48:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 48, 4 al.</bibl></cit>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuper et istae Auxerunt volucrum victae certamine turbam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>have been changed into birds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 301</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4470.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to magnify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to exalt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to extol</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embellish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to praise</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">laudo, laude afficere, verbis extollere, orno): homo tenuis non verbis auget suum munus, sed etiam extenuat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:20:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 20, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid augere atque ornare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:21:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 21, 94</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">rem laudando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:12:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 12, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munus principis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:38 al" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 38 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n4470.4" n="B" level="2"> Aliquem (aliquid) aliquā re, <hi rend="ital">to furaish abundantly with something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to heap upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to enrich</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">load with</hi>: lunae pars ignibus aucta, <hi rend="ital">the part that is entirely filled with fire</hi>, Lucr 5, 722: 3. 630: Tantā laetitiā auctus sum, ut nil constet, poët, ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 4, 14</bibl> oaque vos omnia bene juvetis, bonis auctibus auxitis, old form of prayer in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alter te scientia augere potest, altera exemplis,</quote> <trans><tr>the one can enrich you with learning</tr>, <tr>the other furnish you with examples</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid divitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:26:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 26, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commodis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus augeri solet consilio, auctoritate, sententiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratulatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 11</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">honoribus praemiisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 5</bibl>: augeri damno, <hi rend="ital">to be enriched with a loss</hi> (said comically), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberalitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">largitione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomine imperatorio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognomento Augustae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 26</bibl></cit> et saep.—Also without <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">Di me equidem omnes adjuvant, augent, amant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 3, 3, 27</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem augere atque ornare,</quote> <trans><tr>to advance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut augendi alterius aut minuendi sui causā aliquid dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:6:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 6, 22</bibl></cit> solum te commendat augetque temporis spatium, <hi rend="ital">honors</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:24" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 24</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4470.5" n="C" level="2"> In the lang. of religion, t. t. (like mactare, adolere, etc.), <hi rend="ital">to honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reverence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worship by offerings</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aliquid cedo, Qui vicini hanc nostram augeam aram [Apoliinis],</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 4, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quā ipse meis venatibus auxi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 407</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4470.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become greater</hi> (rare; syn.: augesco, cresco, incresco; on this use of vbs. com. <hi rend="ital">act.</hi>, v. Ellis ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:22:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 22, 11</bibl>): eo res eorum auxit, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:12:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 12, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque adeo parcunt fetus augentque labore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignoscendo populi Romani magnitudinem auxisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1</bibl></cit> (Fragm. Orat. Philipp. contra Lepid. § <cit><quote lang="la">6): O decus eximium magnis virtutibus augens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:323" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 323</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">balnea Romae ad infinitum auxere numerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 122</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 16, 13, § 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veram potentiam augere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 41</bibl></cit> (Halm, <hi rend="ital">augeri</hi>).—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">auctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <cb n="AUGU" /> <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">enlarged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increased</hi>, <hi rend="ital">great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundant;</hi> in <hi rend="ital">posit.</hi> only as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctum vocabatur spatium, quod super definitum modum victoriae adjungitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Ex Fest. p. 14</bibl></cit> Müll. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanto mi aegritudo auctior est in animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctior est animi vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:450" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 450</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctior et amplior majestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:16" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctius atque Di melius fecere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 3</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: auctissima basis, Treb. Gall. 18.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> probably not in use, for in <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Met. 4, p. 290</bibl> Oud., <hi rend="ital">altius</hi> is the correct reading.</sense></entryFree>
augesco: <entryFree id="n4471" type="main" key="augesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">augesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n4471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch.</hi> [augeo], <hi rend="ital">to begin to grow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become greater</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increase</hi> (syn.: cresco, incresco); lit. and trop.: qui rem Romanam Latiumque augescere vultis, Enn. ap, Acron. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 37</bibl> (Ann. v. 455 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">mare et terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1109</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:878" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 878</bibl>; 5, 251; 5, 334; <cit><quote lang="la">6, 616: semina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:10:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus animantes alantur augescantque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 19, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 15, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">augescunt corpora dulcibus atque pinguibus et potu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 54, 118, § 283</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">augescente flumine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 34</bibl></cit>: mihi cotidie augescit magis De filio aegritudo, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jugurthae Bestiaeque et ceteris animi augescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occurrendum augescentibus vitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 37, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 57 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">augescente licentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">augescente superstitione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 61</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
augias: <entryFree id="n4472" type="main" key="Augi_as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Augīas</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Augēas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Augēus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 30" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 30</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Orthog. Fragm. 33</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*au)gei/as</foreign>, <sense id="n4472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of the Sun and Naupidame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the daughter of Amphidamas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Elis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one of the Argonauts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 14</bibl>. His stable, containing three thousand head of cattle, uncleansed for thirty years, was cleaned in one day by Hercules, at the command of Eurystheus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 8, 300</bibl>. Hence the prov.: Cloacas Augiae purgare, <hi rend="ital">to cleanse an Augean stable</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to perform a difficult and unpleasant labor</hi>, Sen. Apocol. (Gr., <foreign lang="greek">kaqai/pein thn ko/pron tou= *au)geiou</foreign>).</sense></entryFree>
augifico: <entryFree id="n4473" type="hapax" key="augi^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">augĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>augeo-facio</etym>, <sense id="n4473.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to increase</hi>: numeros, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 76, 1</bibl> (Trag. v. 105 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
auginos: <entryFree id="n4474" type="greek" key="augi_no^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">augīnŏs</orth>, i. <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">au)gh(</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n4474.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> hyoscyamos, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
augites: <entryFree id="n4475" type="greek" key="augi_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">augītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">au)gi/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n4475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, acc. to many, <hi rend="ital">the turquoise</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 54, § 147</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
augmen: <entryFree id="n4476" type="main" key="augmen"><orth extent="full" lang="la">augmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>augeo</etym>, <sense id="n4476.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an increase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enlargement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">augmentation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">growth</hi> (only ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:495" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 495</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:268" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 268</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Augmine vel grandi vel parvo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 435</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">augmine donare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1307" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1307</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magni augminis coluber,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 249</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sursus enim versus gignuntur et augmina (flammarum corpora) sumunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sumant augmina noctes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:681" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 681</bibl></cit>; for <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 231</bibl>, v. augmentum <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
augmento: <entryFree id="n4477" type="hapax" key="augmento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">augmento</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>augmentum</etym>, <sense id="n4477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to increase</hi>: thesauros, Firm. Math. 5, 6.</sense></entryFree>
augmentum: <entryFree id="n4478" type="main" key="augmentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">augmentum</orth> (in MSS. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">augŭ-mentum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>augeo</etym>, <sense id="n4478.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an increase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">growth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">augmentation</hi> (very rare; mostly post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n4478.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">augmentum corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,010:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eph. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crescit in augmentum Dei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Col. 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">augmentum aut deminutio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:13:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 13, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:30:8" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 30, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lunae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 13, 6 al.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dabit capiti tuo augmenta gratiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Macc. 9, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4478.2" n="II" level="1"> In the lang. of religion (cf. augeo, I. C.), <hi rend="ital">a kind of sacrificial cake</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=112" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 112</bibl> Müll.; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 231</bibl> (where others read <hi rend="ital">augmina</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
augur: <entryFree id="n4479" type="main" key="augur"><orth extent="full" lang="la">augur</orth>, <itype>ŭris</itype> (earlier also <orth extent="full" lang="la">auger</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 554</bibl> P.), <gen>comm.</gen> (cf. Prob. p. 1455 P., and Phoc. p. 1695 P.) [avis and Sanscr. gar, to call, to show, make known. Van.], <sense id="n4479.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an auqur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diviner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soothsayer; at Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a member of a particular college of priests</hi>, <hi rend="ital">much reverenced in earlier ages</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who made known the future by observing the lightning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the flight</hi> or <hi rend="ital">notes of birds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the feeding of the sacred fowls</hi>, <hi rend="ital">certain appearances of quadrupeds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and any unusual occurrences</hi> (v dirae). </sense><sense id="n4479.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Interpretes Jovis optumi maxumi, publici augures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 20</bibl></cit>; Fest. s. v. quinque, p. 26 Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 3, 537</bibl>; and others cited in Müll. Etrusk. 2, p. 116 sq., and Smith, Dict. Antiq. (diff. from auspex, orig. as a general idea from a particular one, since the auspex observed <cb n="AUGU" /> only the flight of birds; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 429, 26</bibl>. Yet as this latter kind of augury was the most common, the two words are frequently interchanged or employed in connection; cf. Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div 1, 48, 107</bibl>: dant operam simul auspicio augurioque).—</sense><sense id="n4479.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">any soothsayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diviner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seer</hi>, in gen.: augur Apollo, as <hi rend="ital">god of prophecy</hi> (v. Apollo), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 32</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">augur Phoebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> C. S. 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Argivus,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>Amphiaraus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 16, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:14:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 14, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veri providus augur Thestorides,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Calchas</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 307</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 596</bibl>; 3, 349; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 512 al.: nocturnae imaginis augur,</quote> <trans><tr>interpreter of night-visions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 5, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pessimus in dubiis augur timor,</quote> <trans><tr>fear</tr>, <tr>the basest prophet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:6" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae nisi fallit augur Annosa cornix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:17:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 17, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simque augur cassa futuri!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:629" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 629</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:18:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 18, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Isa. 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Jer. 27, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">augures caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:47:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Isa. 47, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
augura: <entryFree id="n4480" type="main" key="augu^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">augŭra</orth>, v. augurium <sense id="n4480.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
auguraculum: <entryFree id="n4481" type="gloss" key="augu^ra_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">augŭrācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>auguror</etym>, <sense id="n4481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name by which the citadel of Rome was anciently called</hi>, <hi rend="ital">because the augurs there observed the flight of birds</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=18" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 18</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
auguralis: <entryFree id="n4482" type="main" key="augura_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">augùrālis</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">augŭrĭālis</orth>, App. Not. Aspir. § 8), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>augur</etym>. <sense id="n4482.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to augurs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relating to soothsaying</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prophecy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">augurial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:33:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 33, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 4</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Müll. Etrusk. 1, p. 122: jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:77:267" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 77, 267</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cena,</quote> <trans><tr>which the augur gave on his entrance into office</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:6:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 6, 6</bibl></cit>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">insignia, Liv 10, 7: sacerdotium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:6:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 6, 4</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n4482.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">augŭrāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n4482.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A part of the headquarters of a Roman camp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where the general took auguries</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">structam ante augurale aram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egressus augurali,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 13</bibl></cit>.—Hence (pars pro toto), <hi rend="ital">the principal tent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabernaculum ducis, augurale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4482.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The augur</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s wand</hi> or <hi rend="ital">staff</hi> = lituus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
